scenes.location: SUBTERRANEAN ROOM. LATE DAY. SAME TIME.
characters: LEVELS THOSE MALEVOLENT EYES AT HIM NOW --AND ROARS, THE
SAME BULLETS --FLYING RIGHT THROUGH THE CREATURE AND INTO
IT CRASHES NOISILY TO THE GROUND ON TOP OF THEM. GLASS AN
WHERE THERE'S A HELL THERE'S A
THEY HEAR HER GASP ONLY ONCE. NOW A CHOKED, GARGLING SOUN
SOUND OF THE TRAIN FADES IN THE DISTANCE AND THE BELLS AT
EXT. TRAIN CROSSING. MORNING. TWO HOURS LATER.
AS SUDDENLY A FRIGHTENED AND VOCAL TORRENT OF CATS RUSH I
THE VAN ROARS THROUGH THE RAILWAY CROSSING, BREAKING THRO
CREATURE'S MOUTH GAPING OPEN AND COLLIDING WITH HIS HEAD.
A SOUND APPROACHING WITH IT NOW. A RADIO BLARING AND TWO
WITH THE SOUND FROM ABOVE, OF ONE CAT CLEARLY ATTACKING -
THE VAN CONCAVES IMMEDIATELY. RUPTURING THE GAS TANK AND
THE TERRIBLE SOUNDS OF CRACKING AND CRUNCHING BENEATH THE
POWERFUL SHOWER OF GLASS AND WOOD.
EXPLODING IN A SAVAGE BALL OF FIRE THAT SENDS ROCKETS OF
EXPLODE IN EVERY DIRECTION. SOMETHING LARGER RIPPING SKYW
SMOKE AND FLAME LAUNCHING OUT OF THE INFERNO IN ALL
THE SCARECROW DISINTEGRATES. RIPPING INTO SHADOWY BITS TH
THE SOUND OF TRICKLING. SOMETHING TRICKLING ONTO THE GROU
THE TRAIN ROARS AHEAD -ITS WHISTLE BLASTING AS THE VAN
THIS TIME THE TRAIN WHISTLE CALLS BACK TO IT.
REACHES THE TRACKS AT THE SAME MOMENT.
ONE OFFICER SCREAMS BEHIND HIM -HIS BODY RIDDLED WITH THE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An empty ribbon of asphalt. Winding through an endless stretch of meadows and farmlands. For a long moment, sile Then, a distant speck. A car moving toward us.

dialogues.speaker: RAISED VOICES SINGING WITH IT.
dialogues.text: TRISHA JAMES is a beautiful girl of twenty. Hair blowing the breeze of the open passenger window. She sings out, banging the side of the car with her hand. Keeping the be of the boisterous rock song. She sings with younger brother DARRY. Nineteen. Attractiv like his sister. Lighter hair. Softer looking. Striking e Voice raised as they speed along. Trying to swallow up th road as quickly as possible. The backseat has a couple of suitcases and a large basket wrapped in a garbage bag. The song comes to an end as Dar flies through an abandoned intersection.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: That was a stop sign.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: You're kidding, right?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: In your car I'd be kidding.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: You think we're actually gonna run into anyone else on this road? Relax! (turns the radio louder, shouts over it) Enjoy the countryside! The ANGRY MUSIC WAILING and the car blasting down the tranquil road. We watch as it heads for what seems like infinity. EXT. LONELY COUNTRY ROAD. DAY. SOME TIME LATER.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Okay, here comes... Trish and Darry slowing down now. Coming up on a camper/trailer. Brother and sister stare at the license plate:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DARRY (cont'd) (reads it loudly) "Six A Forever!" (grins) That's mine! That's five to five. Tied up.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: What does it mean? (off his look) "Six A Forever" what does it mean?

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: ‘Cause it says "Sexy Forever", stupid, that's mine. That's five to four.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Since when did you start ace- ing me at this game?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Since you were ten. It involves English and reading. Darry guns the engine. Goes into the oncoming lane to pas the camper/trailer. TRISH (cont'd) Come on, Darry. They pass the cab of the truck. An OLD MAN of sixty behin the wheel. His WIFE next to him. He glares down at Trish Darry as they pass him.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Sexy forever huh?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: You know that is you in forty years.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Note to self: Die young. (checks his rearview) Any place but here on this unbelievably endless road.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: You wanna be sucking in exhaust fumes on the Interstate?

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: No I love stopping at train tracks every ten minutes. No further comment from big sister. She's suddenly some p else. DARRY (cont'd) You know there's usually a reason when you like the long way home.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Gee like, maybe I like the country?

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: (mocking sincerity) Okay.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Just drive, brat.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: I'm only thinking the same thing mom and dad are gonna be thinking: how come you're driving home for Spring break with baby brother? Not heading off somewhere with "Mr .Poly-Sci-Track-Team-Guy"?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: And I'11 tell you what I'd tell them: none of your Goddamned business-

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: (swerves a little) Jesus! The van is tailgating them at an alarming velocity. Rattl and shimmying it is so old and distressed.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Darry!

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: What's this guy trying to do?! He tries to find the driver in the rearview. The Van's windshield is heavily tinted.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Just get out of his way!

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: He's nuts!

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: (emphatically) Get out of his way, Darry! Darry swerves into the oncoming lane and the van tears forward. Blasting toward the distant horizon. Both brother and sister watch breathless. Catching its rusting and personalized license plate: TRISH (cont'd) Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: (back in the right lane) Shit!

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: What the Hell is his problem?

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: My first guess: inbreeding! He has shouted this last word out the window toward the distant van. DARRY (cont'd) Get a load of that thing? Vehicle of choice for five out of ten serial killers. Brother and sister still trying to catch their breath as van disappears over a distant rise.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: God you know what I just thought of, right?

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Kenny and Darla. (off Trish's nod) They died about a hundred miles from here.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: It was the same highway.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: This highway runs the length of the State.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: You think it really happened?

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: That they had to go looking for her head?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: No that they never found her. Or him. They only found the car.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: No, they never found her head. They found the car but they couldn't find him or her head.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Look at me... (holds out her hand) I'm still shaking.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: You don't think every generation has their cautionary tale of drinking and driving on Prom Night?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: I always heard it was real. That they were Class of '80. After I heard that story, I used to think this was the highway I_ would die on.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Quite the cheery thinker, today. What did "Poly-sci guy do to you anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She isn't listening. Thoughts elsewhere again. DARRY (cont'd) “Beating you" (off her look) That was the license plate on the van: B-E-A-T-N-G-U". (turns to her) “Beating you", that's five to five. That ties us up.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: You can't call it now.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: My ass...

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: You have to call it when you see it!

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: I was in shock! THE JANGLING BELLS OF A RAILROAD CROSSING AHEAD. DARRY (cont'd) You know I don't remember there being so many rules to this game. Trish and Darry slowing as the bells ring and the bars lo DARRY (cont'd) ‘Course when there was, you were the one making ‘em. Little Miss Junior Nazi with the Barbie Doll and the Easy Bake Oven... Darry looks down the tracks. Sees the small cargo train approaching. Revs the engine.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Don't you dare. (off his look) My car. Trish sniffs. Smells something. Looks in the backseat. Th big thing covered in a trash bag. She lifts the plastic: full laundry basket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRISH (cont'd) You are a class act, you know that?

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Hey you live off campus. (she just stares at him) You ever try and do laundry in a dorm? What they don't steal they dye pink for you. I've got twelve pair of rosey-pink jockey shorts.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Maybe they know something about you, you don't. She takes the Deodorizer hanging off the rearview mirror stuffs it in the bag. TRISH (cont'd) Hi mom, haven't seen you forever, here's my dirty shorts. The train is upon them now. He shouts over the din.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Its for her, not me. I have to bring home laundry. I don't, she gets depressed. Like she thinks I don't need her anymore or something. Trish's look says she isn't buying it. The SHORT TRAIN RO PAST. Leaves the car waiting for bells to stop and the ba to rise.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: You talk to her lately?

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: To tell her I'd be home for break.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: She sound like anything was going on? Darry throws her a look.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: (impatient) Did you listen to her voice?

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Specify please.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: I think maybe something's wrong. (off his look) I don't think they're telling us. (off his continued look) Like you would notice anything past the point of your own selfish little existence. The bars go up and the car flies over the tracks. Continu its trek down the two-lane.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: If mom and dad were gonna get a divorce don't you think they'd have done it by now?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: No I think they would've waited till we were both grown and off at school.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Whatever.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: She's not happy. Not even a little bit. Not like she used to be.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Who is? (spots something) Hey... They are driving past an old abandoned church set back fr the road. DARRY (cont'd) You see it? Her sister peers past him. In the church's side yard, the van is parked. The one that almost ran them off the road. DARRY (cont'd) It's "Beating You".

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: What's he doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what they both see now is something much more ominous A tall, dark figure dropping something large and oblong d an old drainage pipe in the back of the church.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: What the Hell is that... The oblong object is gone in an instant. Swallowed up by large mouth of the old protruding pipe. The kid's view blocked now by the church.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Don't slow down!

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: You think he saw us?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: What the Hell was he doing?

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: He dumped something down that pipe.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Wrapped in a sheet.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Wrapped and roped in a sheet.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Wrapped and roped in a sheet with red stains on it. Both of them study the rearview mirror now. TRISH (cont'd) Vehicle of choice for five out of ten what? Darry guns the engine.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: I don't think he saw us.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Don't get us killed.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: You see him? Both watch the old church get smaller in their view.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Nope. Someone appears high on the old roof. Standing next to th sagging steeple.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: What the- Appears so suddenly it could almost be the Figure had lea up there. Darry stares at this, perplexed. DARRY (cont'd) You see that? She hasn't. Just the distant figure on the roof, looking after them. Some kind of long coat flapping in the wind l a cape.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Just get us out of here Darry! The figure drops from view as quickly as he appeared. A glance between brother and sister and Darry increases s

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Grab my cell phone!

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: In the gym bag! Trish starts rummaging. Finds the cell phone. Flips it op Powers it up. Staring back at the church. THE PHONE GIVES OUT A LOW BATTERY ALERT.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: The point of having a portable phone idiot, is so that it works when you need it.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: I have a power cable for it!

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: (stuffs the phone back in the bag) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRISH (cont'd) And I have a cigarette lighter that doesn't work!

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: I told you we shoulda’ taken my car! Trish pales. Staring out the back. In the distance the dark van is now leaving the old churc and taking the road again.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Oh Jesus... Heading toward them.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: (in the rearview) You gotta be kidding me... THEY CAN HEAR THE VAN'S DISTANT ENGINE BEING GUNNED.... Darry floors it, the little car ripping down the highway the old van swoops after it -looking like a dark bird of prey. Darry staring down at the speedometer. He's up to ninety the little car is starting to shake. Darry checks the rearview mirror. The van still gaining.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: What the Hell's he got in that thing? He's got it suped up or something- The car speeds down the two lane trying desperately to ke but the van continues to gain -SCREAMING TOWARD THEM.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Darry!!! He's right on our ass!!!

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: I can see him! The van is only a few yards from them now. Darry's foot slamming the pedal to the metal. He and she staring back at the van's tinted windshield. Glints in the sun. No driver can be seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DARRY (cont'd) Hang on-

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Darry-

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: I'm gonna try something.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Darry don't kill us... He is staring up ahead at a gravel road that shoots sharp off the highway. Just as the van lurches up to their rear bumper -its dark face and grill filling the rear and sideview mirrors. TRISH (cont'd) Darry what're you doing?

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ- BAM! THE VAN SLAMS THE BACK OF THE CAR. At its top speed, the car shimmies and shakes. Darry weav in and out of the oncoming lane several times before regaining control. DARRY (cont'd) I don't believe this- WOOOONNNNKKKKKK! !!!! THE HORN FROM THE VAN BLARES -but i a sound they have never heard come from an auto before. This could almost be the deep, guttural sound of a wailin beast.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: What the Hell does he want?! (screaming out the back) Are you out of your fucking mind?!!! WHAM! The van hits the back of the sedan again.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Christ! Darry almost in tears. Trying desperately to control the as it crosses the oncoming lane and roughly lurches onto dirt shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sedan shakes violently as Darry tries to get it back asphalt again. His sister screams -a big ditch dead ahead. Darry grapple the wheel and as the sedan spits up dirt, he swings the c back onto asphalt again. The van tails them across the oncoming lane and back acro the highway. WOOOONNNKKKKK! !! THE STRANGE, BRUTAL HORN WAILS AGAIN. Darry is almost up to the gravel road that shoots off the lane. DARRY (cont'd) Hang on! Trish just stares at her brother. The boy is shaken. Eyes full of fear. She looks back at the van. It is charging a at them again.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: What the fuck is the matter with you?!!!! WHAMM!!! Struck again from behind -Darry really loses control. Tries to swing onto the gravel roadway -but leav the two lane at a terrifying speed, unable to negotiate t sharp turn. Blasting through a wooden fence and into an open field. Darry slams on his brakes as they rocket into tall grass. The windshield is whipped with grass as the car's brakes up and the vehicle continues to fly forward. A cloud of birds flutters out of the deep grass in front them as inside the car, brother and sister are tossed aro like ragdolls. Trish trying desperately to fasten her seatbelt. Darry ju leaning into that brake. TRISH (cont'd) Goddammitt!!! The car swings around and stops. Jostling to a halt in so even taller grass and bringing a sudden and eerie silence Only the breathing of brother and sister can be heard ins the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That and the sound of the van's engine pounding away in t distance. Out Trish's dirtied window, she can see the highway throu the grass. She and Darry stare out. The old van is not even slowing. Continuing at its terrif speed down the two lane. Brother and sister staring after it. Breathless as it disappears in the distance. They look at each other. Both seem to be intact. Without word, Darry opens the car door. In some kind of shock. Ta a step out. ANOTHER GAGGLE OF BIRDS SUDDENLY FLAPPING THEIR WINGS. Blasting out from deep grass beyond Darry. Scares the shi out of him.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: You fuckers! Picks up a rock. Throws it at their ascending cloud. Need take out his anger and frustration. Picks up another one. Looks over at his sister. Trish is standing now, staring out at the highway. The va long gone. DARRY (cont'd) Still like the country? She turns and looks at him. DARRY (cont'd) The next time Poly-Sci guy pisses you off I'm gonna kick his fucking ass! Trish just looks at the car, surrounded by the tall grass EXT. GRAVEL ROAD. DAY. MINUTES LATER. Dirtied and scraped, the small car emerges slowly from th tall grass. Trish behind the wheel now. Darry looking out passenger window. They back out of the field. Through the opening in the wo fence that they made going in. Roll the car onto the grav drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pointed again toward the highway, Trish guns the engine b doesn't move. Looks to her brother.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Sounds alright, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Like either of us would know.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: (defending his manhood) I know a little.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: When your car makes a strange noise you just buy a new tape Darry, that's what you told me.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Told you? I learned it from you!

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Asshole.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Bitch.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Mama's boy.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Daddy's whore.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Dick Licker.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Ball sniffer.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Ass kisser.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Butt picker.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Hah! Repeat! Ass and butt! You lose. Looks over at Trish and smiles. She too. They need a smil about now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trish rolls to the end of the gravel drive. Stops at the highway. Looks both ways. Darry's hand on the wheel sudde

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: I'm thinking past the point of my own selfish little existence now, okay? What if that really was a person he dumped down that pipe? What if it was someone still alive? Trish just stares at her brother. DARRY (cont'd) Someone who needs help but doesn't get it. Or doesn't get it ‘till it's too late.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: We can get help just as fast by getting to a phone-

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: You know how far we are from the nearest pay phone?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Is this your idea of an adventure or something? 'Cause this is why girls are smarter, okay?

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Hey we almost got killed! You don't wanna even find out why?! She isn't wanting or liking this. DARRY (cont'd) We look in the pipe. That's all we do. (off her look) We look in the pipe and if there's nothing there or nothing we can do, we just drive on home and call the cops. Trish stares unwilling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DARRY (cont'd) You know I'm right.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Bullshit I do!

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Look me straight in the eye and tell me I'm not right. She won't look at him. He knows he has her now. DARRY (cont'd) Come on, right in the eye. She turns and glares at him as she throws the car in gear

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: I'm not getting out of the car. Darry smiles. Trish heads out onto the highway. Back towa the old church. EXT. OLD CHURCH. LATE DAY. MINUTES LATER. The car stops on the empty two-lane just before the old church. Darry and Trish regard it. Check the rearview too Empty road. Empty church yard.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Every bone in my body is telling me not to do this.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Where would men be if they spent their lives listening to women's bodies? She gives him a look. Rolls into the drive. The old churc sagging and gray and has not been a place of worship in m years. They drive around the side. Both staring up at the old steeple. And the THREE BLACK CROWS perched on the cross w one arm has rotted off. The back of the place is covered in soil. No parking lot. Just moist dirt and leaves. Mulch. And ahead, through the windshield, the large drain pipe sticking out of the grou Trish drives slowly toward it. Stops a few yards away. Lo at her brother. Suddenly Darry doesn't look so brave eith

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: I'm just gonna look.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: You look like you're gonna puke. Darry opens the car door. Gets out. Looks out to the high Then the surrounding woods in back of the church. No one. Moves toward the old pipe when the sound of his sister tu his head.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Let's do this and do it fast. They approach the pipe warily. It is corrugated metal and sticks out of the ground about three feet. Angled into th ground, its jagged metal mouth is about three feet wide.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Drainage pipe or something? Trish and Darry stare down the dark tunnel. A breeze come out of it. And a terrible stench...

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Oh my God... She covers her mouth and stares at her brother.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: That breeze has to come from somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Somewhere rank.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Doesn't look like a sewer pipe.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Come on Darry! We can't see anything down there!

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: (nods to the car) You gotta flashlight? She throws him a cold look. Moves back to the car. Darry stares down into the pitch.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Hello? Listens to his echo.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Anybody down there? Again his voice rebounding. Looks back toward the car whe the smallest of sounds drifts up the pipe. Darry whirls back to it. Stares in. SOMEWHERE DOWN IN THE DARK, A MURMUR. A SOFT, MUFFLED, HUMAN SOUND.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Hello? (to Trish) Hurry up! Trish brings the flashlight. Darry grabs it out of her ha Shines it down the long length of metal.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Hello?! (off her look) There's someone down there! I just heard them! (again into the dark) Hello?! The light reveals dark earth at the bottom of the pipe. S twenty-five feet down.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: You're hearing things. Darry tests the strength of the pipe. It is anchored soli in the ground.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Darry, don't even think about it. He hoists himself up into the mouth.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: I told you I heard someone! Crouched inside the pipe, he stares down. Holds the flashlight with one hand and the lip of the tube with the other.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: You know the part in scary movies where somebody does something really stupid and everybody hates them for it? (off his look) This is it! A small, scuffling sound from below. Trish hears this. Darry stares down the tunnel, darkness with the flashlight. Looks back at her. expression asks her Did you hear that?! Now worming his way further into the opening of

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: No Darry!

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Let me slide down-

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Goddamnitt

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Just let me get a little way in-

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: You're not going down there!

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: I'm not! Just hold my feet. 20 raking the His the tunnel. As he lays down inside the tube, flashlight extended, Tri grabs her brother's ankles.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Anybody down there?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: God when was the last time you washed any socks?

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: I see something! He strains to look back at her. Trish too scared to comme

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: (shouts down again) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: I'm counting to ten Darry.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Something's moving down there...

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Then I am letting go and going back to my car-

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Quiet! (peers forward) I just saw it again. Something is definitely moving down here- Moving alright -directly into Darry's flashlight beam. TW TERRIFIED RATS -darting directly at him.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Abbhhh!!!!!

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Darry!!!!!

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Rats!!!! The rodents run right up over his shoulders. He screams. Thrashes. They scurry onto his back. Rushing up...

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: (trying to keep hold of his kicking feet) It's what?!

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: It's rats!!!! But he doesn't need to tell her. The rats run right at he now! One down each of Darry's legs! Trish screams -releasing her brother's still thrashing fe It's a tie who screams louder: Trisha stumbling back as t rats leap to the ground -or brother Darry as he slides al the way down the large pipe. A GREAT THUD BELOW. Trish charges toward the pipe as the rodents scurry into the leaves.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Darry!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her voice echoes into darkness as she stares down.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Darry?!

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Owww! Fell right on my head. INT. SUBTERRANEAN ROOM. CHURCH. LATE DAY. SAME TIME. Darry rubs his neck. Winces in the dark. Rust and dust trickle down from the pipe. He sits in the dim pool of daylight from above. Squints up into it.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Why'd you let go?!

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: How the Hell're you gonna get out of there, idiot! Darry stands slowly. Looks up the drain pipe.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: I can climb out, relax your crack. He bends and gropes for the flashlight outside the circle light. Finds it. Switches it on. The first thing the light hits, is the edge of something wrapped in a bloody sheet. Darry stops. This is what they saw being dumped down the tube.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Darry? Brother doesn't answer. Takes a terrified step toward it.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Do it then, climb out please. There can be no question it is a body. Blood stains on th head and midsection. Sheet around it. Tied with rope at t neck and ankles.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Say not so, sis.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: h (peering down) What?

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: (to himself now) Say not so... He bends to it. Studies the head as he pales.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Hello? Feels like an idiot talking to it. But does anyway.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Did I hear you down here? No response. Swallows. Has no choice but to touch it. Gen on the arm. Pushes it. Testing it.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Darry what in the Holy Hell are you doing down there?!

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: I found our body.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: You found what? Darry still staring at. Paling.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: I found the body. Darry starts to get up. Grabbed! By a hand! DARRY WAILS. Lurches away from it, stumbling back. The bo is moving under its bloody sheet. Twitching. Trying to breathe.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Oh God!

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Darry?

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Oh God!!! Darry dashes toward it. Crashes to his knees. Starts tear at the sheet around its head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sheet being sucked in and out around the mouth now. I gasping for air. Darry trying to tear the sheet. To get a grip on it. The thrashes. Finally -RIPPPPPPP!!!!!! The sheet tears away and Darry stares down in shock. It is A YOUNG MAN. About his age. Deathly gray. Mouth ope mute agony. Eyes wide. Blinking up at him. Darry can only stare in terror. He doesn't know what to d Frantically grabs the sheet. Tears it the rest of the way down the body -stopping abruptly. The young man's bare body has an incision of ugly black stitches --all the way from the navel to the neck. Darry thinks he might be sick. Looks up into those wide e What in God's name did someone do to you? Both boys stare at each other helplessly.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Darry?

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: (can whisper back) Trish... The boy's dry, blue lips are opening. The Adam's apple bo as he tries to swallow. Darry crazy with fear, leans down His ear at the boy's lips as they part again.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: What? A whispered word comes out of his mouth. Choked. Raspy. Unintelligible.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: What did you say? But no more sound comes. Nor breathing. Darry staring wid eyed. Almost catatonic. Backs off him. Slowly.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: I am up here all Goddamned alone little brother! Now get your ass up here, it is getting dark!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her angry voice echoes down. Darry moves to the puddle of light and looks up at her.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Is she dead?

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: He.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Come on, before that guy comes back! Darry nods. Goes to hoist a foot up into the tube but sto His flashlight has swept over something else outside the of daylight. He throws the light along the damp earth, past the lifele body of the boy and over to... Two more bloody, sheet-wrapped bodies. Piled on top of ea other. Darry in shock... Stares numbly at them. Swallows. Starts his head 'no'. Cannot accept this. Will not accept this. Darry charging now, back toward the pool of daylight. EXT. OLD CHURCH. LATE DAY. SAME TIME. Above, Trish sees him hoist himself into the tube and sta furious, frightened climb toward daylight.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Darry? A climb so violent the pipe rocks and shimmies. Rivulets soot and rust trickling down the metal surface.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: What's the matter... But little brother isn't answering. Just clamoring desperately to get back up top and away from this place forever... Halfway up he slips. THE PIPE GROANS as he tries to get n footing.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Be careful!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up at her. His face is dirty and his eyes wide w child-like horror.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: This whole thing is moving... He catches his breath, still staring up at her.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Say something Darry, you're scaring the shit out of me! Darry starts up again. His sister reaching down toward hi Slow crane up: moving above the pipe and above the church High enough to look down the lonely two-lane: And see a van headed toward them in the distance... Darry reaches up for his sister's hand as the PIPE SHRIEK AGAIN. More soot dislodging. Running past him.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Shhh!!! She hears THE APPROACHING ENGINE. Looks down at little br

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Someone's coming... (off his look) Someone's coming!!! In a new panic he grabs Trish's hand. With a concerted ef big sis pulls little brother up to the mouth of the pipe.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: (trying to look behind her) Hurry!!!! WRRANNKKKKK! !!! The pipe makes A NEW, SHRILLER KIND OF SOUND... and Darry can feel the entire thing shift. Really clutching his sister's hand now. Grabs the lip of pipe with the other. But a piece of its jagged, torn meta stabs into his palm. He yells. Retracts his hand violently. Loses his footing. Slides out of Trish's grip. Down he goes again. Thrashing the way.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Darry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gets his footing halfway down. Examines the gash in his h when PING! PING! Just beneath his sneakers, the rusty wel holding the lengths of the pipe together -snap! Darry in the middle of the tube. Staring up at his sister with wide eyes. AS A LOW, ACHING METAL GROAN BEGINS, BUIL QUICKLY.... Darry scrambling up toward the mouth as he realizes what about to happen. Almost to the top when the bottom half of the massive tub falls away. Darry sliding down again with the great jolt. Both he and the pipe plummeting down into the darkness in great cacophony of sound and dust.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Darrrrry! Tries to see through the cloud of dust that shoots up out the tube AS THE SOUND OF THE APPROACHING VAN GETS LOUDER. She whirls toward the highway. Dashes toward her car. Hud in front of it. Peers around the left front wheel. Her he racing. The van comes into view... But not a dark van. This is another, newer van. And it continues down the two-lane without ever stopping. INT. SUBTERRANEAN ROOM. CHURCH. DUSK. MOMENTS LATER. Darry sitting on the ground against the fallen half of th pipe staring at the gash in his hand. Stares up with Tris voice.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: It wasn't him.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: You know you really suck! (stands, holding his arm) In the moment of truth you really don't know how to hang on do you? You just suck-

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: You were the one who wanted to come back here and have a little adventure!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 28 Darry is staring over at the bodies. The two still in she He stares up at his sister again.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Well I hope there's another way outta there.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: _ (angry) Well it's a church basement so I'm guessing the church! The sagging old church. Especially forboding as she regar

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: You don't think I'm going in there?

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: You have to stay out front and watch for people. (off her look) You see anyone? Flag ‘em down! Tell ‘em to get the cops out here right away! Trish liking this less and less.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: I'm gonna find a way up. He starts to move off but calls her again.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Trish? (off her look) You see that van coming, you get back to this pipe and holler down as loud as you can. Now she couldn't like the whole idea less. Darry staring those bodies again.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: I gotta find the flashlight. Trish hurries to the car. Keeping an eye on the old highw She gets in. Starts the engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darry takes the flashlight out from under the fallen leng of pipe. Tries it. It still works. Letting his light lead him, he moves forward.. Ahead: the other two bodies. Piled together. These bloodstains are darker. Browner. How long have they been here? Darry draws in a breath. The smell is getting putrid. In the same moment his light ascends. There are words ove his head. An epitaph, spelled out in bones:

dialogues.speaker: WAY
dialogues.text: Darry really gets a chill now. Doesn't want to wonder if those are human bones. Arranged as they are, on a high ar that leads into a larger, darker subterranean room. Where a hand is sticking out of the wall. His light falls over it. The skin on its splayed fingers looks petrified. Is this a human hand? No question: The rest of the body is part of the wall. Skin leathered with age. Like beef jerky. Teeth infected termites... Head back, mouth open in a scream long gone silent. A body in a wall. But more light reveals more horror. A WALL of bodies.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Oh no... oh God... Darry steps forward, knees shaking. The vast room ahead, walled with dozens of these mounted corpses. Men and women of all ages. Body after body. Stitched together in a hideous tapestry. Large stitches. Identical to those just uncovered beneath that bloody she

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darry swings the light to the other side of the chamber. Another grotesque mural of the dead, extending deep into darkness ahead... God how many bodies are down here? Darry moves forward -drawn by his own need to prove none this can possibly be real! Some bodies are turned away. Skeletal heads looking back their shoulders -petrified backsides showing more stitche Several are as armless as the Venus DeMilo. Some missing other limbs. Heads. Feet. Genitals. Darry's growing repulsion moves him faster -how big is th room? Feels like a football field... Deeper along the hideous walls, Darry turns abruptly. Two withered corpses in the tapestry. On the finger of one: a large ring. An old Varsity ring. beam reflecting off its dusty jeweled surface. Darry star at it with unquestionable recognition. Looks slowly to the corpse beside it. A girl? Once? Her incision is all around her neck. As if her head had been severed and then sewn back on. EXT. OLD CHURCH. DUSK. SAME TIME. Trish parked at the corner of the old church. Keeping an on both directions of the empty two lane. Watching the lo shadows as the sun drops. Feels something creeping over her. Looks up. The sun is dropping behind the steeple of the church, the shadow of the tower slowly falling on her. She sits anxious in its growing darkness. INT. SUBTERRANEAN ROOM. CHURCH. DUSK. SAME TIME. The same below: Darry staring back at the distant archway the dying sunlight. Looks ahead at the cavern of the dead. The ambient light fading away over all those twisted faces... this place is getting really dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darry takes a breath and moves forward quickly. Not quite running. The darkness won't allow this. But walking as quickly as he ever has... The deeper he gets, the fresher the bodies. They no longer have the withered faces and skins like app dolls. They have been a part of the walls for less time. Darry moves faster. Almost running. Grimacing faces of the dead, gaping mouths of mute agony shouting him on. Now practically sprinting through this corridor of death. Tries to keep his eyes straight ahead. Doesn't want to lo at them. Tries not to... Steals a look to one side. Looks back and WHAMMM!!!! Runs directly into someone reaching out for him! Darry has fallen and screams. Backs up on all fours. Stop The figure reaching out is just another corpse on a new w in front of him. He has finally arrived at the end of thi horrible room. Between this corpse and another, Darry can see hinges.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: You're fucking kidding me... This withered corpse, with his outstretched hand is a doo He looks at the hand. The handle? This is what I have to to get out of here? He swallows, draws a breath and reaches out. Avoids the leathery fingers and takes the forearm. Gets his grip. Pulls! The door doesn't move! Darry can't believe what he doing. Gets a tighter grip and pulls again! Hard! This door hasn't been opened in years. Reaches out again -when the corpses' head turns toward him.... with its empty eyes and gaping mouth! Darry leaps away. Staring terrified. But the head has only been jarred loose. It falls now, ri off the neck. Hangs by a leathery strand of flesh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is enough! Darry reaches out. Yanks with all his mig on the forearm of the headless man and in a terrible fren dislodges the door. It comes off its hinges and topples toward Darry -corpse all. The door is heavy and it hits hard -but not as hard as Da hits the ground. The corpse falling on top of him -the head still attached some brittle tendon, nuzzles into his shoulder. Darry doesn't have time to scream -he throws the door off and scrambles forward, through the dark open doorway and some dusty steps beyond. Climbing and screaming. Screaming and climbing. And climb some more... EXT. OLD CHURCH. NIGHT. MOMENTS LATER. Down the highway, two headlights appear. Trish instantly afraid. Stares down at them. Could this b him? Trish looks at the church. Where the Hell is he? The headlights closer now. The vehicle is big. The van? She is suddenly unreasonable with panic. Doesn't know wha do. --The lights of the oncoming vehicle starting to show her face. She ducks. Below the dashboard. Can hear THE ENGINE. HEAV LIKE THE VAN. Lights spilling across the dash now. She reaches up from below. Turns the key. The engine won't turn over. Lights really bright now. Almost upon her. Turns the key again. Goddamn thing won't start! Trish's eyes starting to well. Light filling the interior the car. The engine finally sparks. She is ready. But the lights are passing now. And she peeks over the da at nothing but an old pick up continuing on down the high Trish sits up- SCREAMS!!! SOMEONE AT HER WINDOW. STARING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darry. Almost comatose, staring in at her.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Goddammit Darry!!!! He just stares.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: You asshole! Sees that something is very wrong. Little brother just staring back. EXT. LONELY COUNTRY ROAD. NIGHT. MINUTES LATER. Trish drives in silence. The highway rushing past them. K throwing looks at her brother. Still as a statue. Face di Bloody hand wrapped in a piece of torn T shirt. Eyes star ahead. Oncoming headlights now. Both brother and sister study th Another truck. It rushes past. A sign up ahead:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ® She watches it fly by. Looks to him again.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Would you please just say something?! (no response) I mean it Darry, you're scaring the shit out of me! His voice as subdued as she has ever heard it.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: I saw ‘em, Trish. Kenny and Darla. Class of '80. She just stares.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: They were down there, both of them. (holds up a hand, not looking at her) I saw his ring. He was still wearing his Varsity ring.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: You said that happened a hundred miles from here-

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: I said I saw ‘em! (angry silence) All dead and dried up down there with a whole bunch of others, okay!? She more frightened by his state than by his words. DARRY (cont'd) Don't tell me you don't believe me, alright?! (points a rabid finger at her) Don't make me tell you everything I saw down there ‘cause you don't wanna hear it, okay?! Her brother's eyes fill with angry tears. Then goes silen again. Drops his head against the window. Trish looks at the fuel indicator. Only a quarter of a ta left. DARRY (cont'd) She did lose her head. Looks over at her brother. Staring out the window into th passing night.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Darla lost her head just like they said. (off her look) And you know what he did, Trish? You know what he did for her? He sewed it back on. Darry lets out a little laugh. Is he going crazy?

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Sewed it right back on. EXT. TRENTDALE. NIGHT. TEN MINUTES LATER. Trish's sedan rambles off the two-lane and toward a small cluster of buildings under the starry night sky. Past a weathered and aging sign that reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to TRENTDALE PR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brother and sister look to each other. Neither wants to s

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: We have to or we're not gonna make it home. She continues on toward the only lights. Combination Restaurant and Gas Station. The tall sign stretching into stars announces plainly: Trish pulls in. Rolls under the hot white neon over the g pumps. Looks over at little brother.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: You gonna make a phone call? Darry just nods. Opens the car door.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Throw some water on yourself. You look like you just crawled out of a sewer. Darry moves with fatigue toward the restaurant. Several c and big trucks parked around it. Trish moves to the pump. There is a pad lock on it. She g it. Yanks on it. Turns to her brother.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Darry? (off his look) Pumps are locked. She watches him turn and move inside. INT. DELROY'S FOOD AND GAS. NIGHT. SAME TIME. Darry steps in. Darker than he expected. Stares ahead. Et in the light of a cigarette machine. He must look pretty bad because those who do catch a glim of him, take another one quickly. Like the PLUMP WAITRESS eye-balling him. She is fifty- something. Name tag reads BEVERLY.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS BEVERLY
dialogues.text: Restrooms are for paying customers, kiddo.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Could we get some gas, please? The woman looks out the window, sees Trish leaning agains the car.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: (a well worn rhyme) Pump's locked at eight o'clock. Darry has no energy to argue. Looks out at his sister.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Lights are still on.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: (calls back to the kitchen) Arnie, you got the pump lights on again! Trish suddenly plunged into darkness. Waitress Beverly lo back to Darry as if that settled everything.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: We really need some gas.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS BEVERLY
dialogues.text: You look like you need a little more than gas, kiddo. EXT. DELROY'S FOOD AND GAS. NIGHT. SAME TIME. Trish is fit to be tied. Storms toward the diner. Cursing under her breath. Is almost to the front doors when out o the two lane comes the sound of a familiar engine. This is the sound of the van. There can be no question. She spots it instantly. Sailing down the highway. Speedin past Trentdale. Knows it must be headed back to the old church. INT. DELROY'S FOOD AND GAS. NIGHT. SAME TIME. Trish bursts in. Patrons staring at her. TWO TRUCKERS especially. They don't make eyes at her, but she knows th look. Beverly pouring coffee for them.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS BEVERLY
dialogues.text: Pumps locked at eight o'clock-

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: This is an emergency! Her raised tone turns more than a few heads.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: I need you to please call the police. (off her look) Right now. Please get them here right away. Waitress Beverly stares at her now.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Someone is dead! Can you please just call someone?! Trish meets the eyes of other patrons who have heard this FAMILY with TWO SMALL CHILDREN -eyes wide staring back at her.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS BEVERLY
dialogues.text: Someone's dead where?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Are you gonna call or not?! Beverly regards her a moment longer and starts back towar the kitchen. The Men's Room Door opens and Darry comes ou Washed. Looks better. Until sister rushes at him.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: I saw him! I saw the van again! Darry instantly panicked. Runs toward the windows.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: I think he's headed back to the church!

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: You sure it was the van?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: You think I'm gonna forget what it looks like?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trish lets out an anxious sigh. Falls against the wall. Between the cigarette machine and the payphone. Holds her face in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Come on big sis. Hold it together. She stares at the floor. Won't look at him.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: (takes her by the shoulders) Come on. Just hold it together. (waits for a response) Think of a time.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: I don't wanna think of a time.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: I got one. You were twelve. ‘Cause I was nine.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Just shut-up Darry-

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: And we found that big fat potato bug out in the backyard? Remember how big it was, with the big feeler things on its head? You bet me five dollars I wouldn't be brave enough to eat it. (she looks up at him) You remember. ‘Cause I swallowed it. Whole. Could feel it crawling down my throat. Thought it was gonna make me sick but I had to prove to big sis that "I wasn't afraid of nothing". Then when I finished swallowing it you didn't want to pay me the five dollars so you yelled "Mom! Darry ate a bug!" (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DARRY (cont'd) (the hint of a smile on her face?) Remember? I got spanked and taught about not putting dirty little things in my mouth? Remember? What a nasty little bitch you were? She smiles at him as much as she's able. Darry thinking h cheered her up. But her eyes well with tears as quickly a she says in a frightened whisper:

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: I am so scared, Darry. He is gonna get back to that church and he is gonna know we were down there! THE PAY PHONE RINGS LOUDLY BESIDE HER AND SHE SCREAMS. The entire restaurant is looking at her now. Beverly on t phone by the registers stares over. Along with a roundish furry looking man of fifty or so. The MANAGER. She and little brother stare back at everyone. Embarrasse THE PHONE RINGS AGAIN. Darry waiting for someone to come over and answer the pho THIRD RING NOW.

dialogues.speaker: MAN AT JUKEBOX
dialogues.text: You gonna get that? The MAN closest to them has asked this. He drops a coin i the slot of the juke. Trish picks up the receiver. A WOMAN'S VOICE. URGENCY IN VOICE.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: (filtered) Yes hello?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: (filtered) Are you wearing a white shirt with an emblem on the sleeve?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Am I what?

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: (filtered) Blue jeans? Are you wearing blue jeans? A confused look from Darry to Trish.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: (filtered) Please you have to tell me.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: I -what? Darry grabs the phone away from her.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Who is this?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Darry hang up!

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: (filtered) Darry? You're Darry? (he just listens) I don't know exactly what you look like Darry, but you have very big and very beautiful eyes am I right? Darry just staring at Trish in utter confusion.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: (filtered) They’re big and they’re blue and they’re very beautiful. Darry panicked now. She can see me! He moves quickly to s faces in the dining area. Yanked back when the phone cord won't reach.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: (filtered) Please don't be frightened. You're wearing a pair of blue jeans where the third belt loop is torn. Why is she saying this? Looks to his pants. Third belt lo

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: (filtered) I know how you tore it, too. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WOMAN (cont'd) You tore it on the jagged edge of a metal pipe. Darry really in shock now. Stares at big sister. Trish crowding in to listen with him. WOMAN (cont’'d) (filtered) Can you still hear me?

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: (completely perplexed) You were out there?

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: (filtered) I don't have time to explain.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: You were out there at the church?

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: (filtered) Have you seen the cats yet?

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: The what-

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: (filtered) Have you seen the cats yet? Lots of cats?

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Look who are you and what kind of shit are you trying to pull?! This was loud. The Man at the Jukebox turns to look. So d AN OLD WOMAN at the cigarette machine.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: (filtered) I don't know how to make you listen. The van. I saw the van too. With the license plate.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: “Beating you?"

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: (filtered) No, not "Beating You", think about it again. Once more Darry confused. WOMAN (cont’'d) (filtered) I need you to wait for me. I'm about an hour away. Can you do that?

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Who the Hell am I talking to?

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: (filtered) I have something very important you have to hear from me. I don’t know how I can make you believe that but it’s true!

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: I’m hanging up-

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: (filtered) There’s a song! (again Darry’s confused look at sis) Jeepers Creepers. Do you know it? It’s an old song. INT. UNKNOWN LIVING ROOM. NIGHT. SAME TIME. We cannot see the woman on the telephone but we hear the player nearby. THE VELVETY TONES OF MEL TORME SINGING “Jeepers, Creepers, where’d you get those peepers?”

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Been recorded about a million times. We see several new CDs on a TOWER RECORDS bag. CDs torn o FRANK SINATRA, JOHNNY MERCER, MEL TORME... their cases st about. CDs too. All over the table.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Can you hear it?

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: (filtered) What about it?

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Listen. Very carefully. INT. DELROY'S FOOD AND GAS. NIGHT. SAME TIME.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Look I don’t know what the fuck you're talking about-

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: (filtered) You hear that song? Run. (Darry’s confusion peaking) You listening to me? That song means something terrible is about to happen to you-

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Screw you lady-

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Something so terrible you could never imagine it- Darry hangs up angrily. Moves quickly to look out over th eatery.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: You sure you saw that van on the highway? (off her look) ‘Cause I think the driver might be in here. On a cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: That sounded like a woman!

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Well why couldn't it bea woman? We don't know who it is! He rushes past the cigarette machine. Looks out into the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Somebody messing with us, that's for sure! She knew everything!

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: What did she want? Darry turns and regards his sister.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: For us to wait around, which is exactly what we're not gonna do. INT. DELROY'S FOOD AND GAS. NIGHT. MINUTES LATER. The juke box finishes its selection. Its mechanical arm replaces the 45 and selects another. The place fills with music again. Trish and Darry at a table in back. Beverly steps up to t with a coffee pot.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS BEVERLY
dialogues.text: You kids wanna piece of pie or coffee or something? They shake their heads no, staring at two STATE TROOPERS the counter, conferring with the Manager.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS BEVERLY
dialogues.text: Let me know if you change your mind.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: You think they believe us?

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: All they have to do is drive out to that church. They'll believe every word.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: I don't know if I would. He looks up with this.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Sounds too much like somebody's bad dream. Is she trying to say she doesn't believe him?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: You don't think that's it, do you? We're dreaming? Darry doesn't answer. The juke box fills the silence.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Maybe we're having one of those dreams like in the Twilight Zone where we're all ready dead. You know? We died out on the road and we just don't know it?

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: (quietly) I wanna be home. In my room. In my bed. (eyes up to his sister) Ripping up every Tales from the Crypt and Fangoria I own. He looks at her. Tries to smile. He looks so fragile.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: We will get home you know? He nods. Feeling foolish. "Jeepers Creepers, where'd you get those peepers? Jeepers Creepers, where'd you get those eyes?" The juke box. Sinatra. Darry’s blood runs cold. Face suddenly ashen. Stares across the diner at the juke. Sis watching him strangely. Tries to follow his line of sight. "Gosh all get up, how'd they get so lit up..." He stands. Looks down at sis. “Gosh all get up, how’d the get that size?”

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Darry...? He moves now. Through the diner. As if drawn by the melod “Golly gee, when you turn those heaters on. Woa is me, go put my cheaters on...” Trish watches him from the table. Has little brother gone his nut?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrons are stopping their eating. Watching him as he pas by in some confused trance. “Jeepers, Creepers, where’d you get those peepers? Oh tho weepers, how they hypnotize...” Darry at the jukebox now. Staring down into its glow. Thi he must be losing his mind. His own striking eyes even mo beautiful in the golden glow of the machine. “Where’d you get those eyes?” The song goes instrumental. He looks back at Trish. The Troopers are at her table. Sis looking over at him. Darry moves back quickly. TROOPER GIDEON is a tall, powerful looking Native America Strong face and piercing eyes. His partner TROOPER WESTON a capable looking woman of thirty or so.

dialogues.speaker: TROOPER GIDEON
dialogues.text: I was just telling your sister, we're running the plates and we've got a unit on their way out to the old church.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: TROOPER GIDEON
dialogues.text: Tell me something. These kids you saw on that wall? Who were they again?

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: (looks to his sister) Darla Cleeway and Kenny...

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: -Brandon.

dialogues.speaker: TROOPER GIDEON
dialogues.text: Found their car all smashed up ‘bout twenty years ago? Am I remembering this right? (off Darry's nod) Those bodies would be nothing but bones by now. You said he still had skin on him anda ring on his finger.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: What're you trying to say?

dialogues.speaker: TROOPER GIDEON
dialogues.text: Not saying anything-

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: (on his feet) I told you -I grabbed one of them! It was hard. Like petrified wood! Like he preserved them or something, I don't know!

dialogues.speaker: TROOPER GIDEON
dialogues.text: Well then how do you know they were even real bodies? Darry thrown by this. Stares at the Trooper.

dialogues.speaker: TROOPER GIDEON
dialogues.text: Look all I'm trying to do here is get the facts straight-

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: I told you the facts: this guy drives a black van and it nearly killed us! We saw him throw a body down a pipe, that dumps into a cellar under the old church! I saw the body! He was a guy my age and he was still alive, except that he'd been split from his neck to his navel and then sewn back up again! Now this guy must have a hundred, maybe two hundred bodies down there, and I've seen ‘em!

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: Hey-hey-hey! Doesn't like this grizzly talk, loud enough for people to hear.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: (lowers his voice) I mean this guy must be the Heavyweight Champ of all serial killers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is Trooper Weston who first notices people standing up from their tables and moving to the restaurant windows.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: You don't believe me? Just drive out to that church and see for yourself!

dialogues.speaker: TROOPER GIDEON
dialogues.text: No one's saying you're lying, Darius-

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: It's Darry. Darius is my name, Darry for short. There is quite a crowd at the windows now and he and Tris see it.

dialogues.speaker: TROOPER GIDEON
dialogues.text: And I said we were doing everything we know how to do. They step past Gideon toward the dining area. Waitress Beverly just coming back in the front doors. Looking dire at Trish.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS BEVERLY
dialogues.text: That's your car out at the pumps, isn't it? EXT. DELROY'S FOOD AND GAS. NIGHT. SAME TIME. Trish and Darry blast out into the brisk night. Beverly r behind them. Ahead is their car. Still in shadow at the pumps. But the left rear door is open and spilled out onto the asphalt i Darry's dirty laundry. The Troopers join them now. Watching as brother and siste move quickly toward the car.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS BEVERLY
dialogues.text: Someone saw him from the window. Trish and Darry stop. Turn to her. She nods back to the patrons staring out from inside.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS BEVERLY
dialogues.text: Thought they had to be kidding.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Saw what?!

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS BEVERLY
dialogues.text: (impatient) The man out there at your car! The kids and Troopers instantly look for him.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS BEVERLY
dialogues.text: Well he already ran off!

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: A man?

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS BEVERLY
dialogues.text: More like a pervert. (off their puzzled looks) That's why everyone was watching. He was outside the car there sniffing that laundry. Darry and Trish staring at her.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS BEVERLY
dialogues.text: Holding big handfuls of it under his nose. Looked like he was liking it too. Darry at the car now. Shirts, socks, shorts all spilled o of the basket. Darry looks back at Trish.

dialogues.speaker: TROOPER WESTON
dialogues.text: Ran off which way? Beverly looks back at the patrons at the window. Hollers one of the Truckers.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS BEVERLY
dialogues.text: Which way he run off, Billy? A Trucker at the window points out. Beyond the pumps. Dow the empty and shadowy street.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: It was him. (to the Troopers) He had time to get to the church and then get back here-

dialogues.speaker: TROOPER GIDEON
dialogues.text: Alright, we don't need anymore excitement than we already have-

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: This guy is after us! (throwing fistfuls of laundry in the car) He is after us ‘cause he knows what we saw! The Troopers stare at each other. Trooper Weston on her walkie-talkie.

dialogues.speaker: TROOPER WESTON
dialogues.text: Central this is 037. Come back. Darry finishes with his clothes and goes to shut the door

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Hey, you interested in a hand print? Trish and the Troopers move quickly toward him. Gideon squats with Darry at the open car door. Look at th surface of the car handle. It is smudged with some kind o fine gray powder.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: You can dust it, right? Get a print?

dialogues.speaker: TROOPER GIDEON
dialogues.text: Looks like somebody already did. He looks up at his partner. A breeze comes up and the "pr starts to blow away. Gideon thinks fast. Whips out an evidence bag and catches some of it as it blows into the wind. A_SLOW CRANE UP: As we rise slowly.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: What the Hell is that stuff?

dialogues.speaker: TROOPER GIDEON
dialogues.text: Gonna find out real quick.

dialogues.speaker: TROOPER WESTON
dialogues.text: (on her walkie) Central, this is 037 do you copy?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Can we please get some gas now?

dialogues.speaker: TROOPER GIDEON
dialogues.text: Everybody just keep calm. Everything's gonna get taken care of. ..-until we are high above the parking lot. Everyone belo just tiny dots of jabbering color. We have ascended final to the top of the sign that reads DELROY'S FOOD AND GAS. And atop that, a dark Figure is perched. His long black c flapping in the night wind as he stares down. Like some dark bird of prey... EXT. COUNTRY HIGHWAY. NIGHT. THIRTY MINUTES LATER. WOOSSHHH!!! Trish's car flies past us down the starlit tw lane. Headlights burning into the night. Behind them, ano pair of headlights. A STATE TROOPER CAR. Darry looks back at them.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: (at the wheel) They're still back there.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: I'll bet having a good laugh too.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: You still don't think they believe us?

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: (regards his sis for a moment ) How'd he get up on the roof of that church?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: How did he what?

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: It look like he jumped up there to you?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Onto the roof of a building? Darry feels dumb. Stares out the window.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: What the Hell was he doing with your clothes? She smirks suddenly. Then laughs.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Maybe he can leap tall buildings in a single bound. I mean he’d have to be superhuman, otherwise the smell would've killed him! INT. TROOPER CAR. COUNTRY HIGHWAY. NIGHT. SAME TIME. Troopers Gideon and Weston in the car escorting them. Gid driving. THEIR RADIO SOUNDS.

dialogues.speaker: CENTRAL VOICE
dialogues.text: (filtered) This is Central, 037 come back.

dialogues.speaker: TROOPER WESTON
dialogues.text: 037, go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: CENTRAL VOICE
dialogues.text: (filtered) Higgs and Corely just radio-ed back from the old church on East 9?

dialogues.speaker: TROOPER WESTON
dialogues.text: Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: CENTRAL VOICE
dialogues.text: (filtered) Its on fire. Gideon and Weston staring at each other.

dialogues.speaker: CENTRAL VOICE
dialogues.text: (filtered) Burning out of control, with Fire and Rescue on the way. INT. TRISH'S CAR. COUNTRY HIGHWAY. NIGHT. SAME TIME. Darry watches Trish. She keeps checking her rearview.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Don't tell me you actually like him.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Get real.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: (knows its true now) Oh God. (looks back at the cop car) Should'a known. He's big, dumb and stupid.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Unlike the Braniacs you take out. Braniacs only if they're brains come in twos and lift and separate.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: You're probably gonna marry a cop. You have a thing for guys in uniform or something?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Well they’re not quite as easy as the bimbos you flash those Bambi eyes at. Watch ‘em fall down with their legs apart. Darry doesn’t like this. Reminds him of the phone call. D you have big beautiful eyes? Sis checks the rearview agai

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: I did notice he was a little more interested in getting the story from me than from you.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: (bothered now) Would you stop looking back there? He's gonna think you're easy.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: He did have a nice ass.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: I know, he was talking out of it. Darry cranks up the radio. AN ANGRY ROCK TUNE BLARES. INT. TROOPER CAR. COUNTRY HIGHWAY. NIGHT. MOMENTS LATER.

dialogues.speaker: CENTRAL VOICE
dialogues.text: (filtered) Plates are fake. Description of the van those kids gave, corresponds to a model from 1947. We're talking antiques now.

dialogues.speaker: TROOPER WESTON
dialogues.text: These kids say that van chased them doing well over a hundred, go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: CENTRAL VOICE
dialogues.text: (filtered) You ever stop to think these kids might be trying to pull off some kind of major hood wink?

dialogues.speaker: TROOPER WESTON
dialogues.text: Come again?

dialogues.speaker: CENTRAL VOICE
dialogues.text: (filtered) The preliminary came back on that dust you took off the car handle? Its dead skin. BWUMP! Something has hit the roof of the police car. Gideon and Weston staring up at the roof. Puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: CENTRAL VOICE
dialogues.text: (filtered) Not just dead skin. Long dead. That's why it was powder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trish and Darry staring ahead -ROCK SONG BLARING. Neither looking behind them. Something black with a cape whipping in the wind perched the roof of their escort's car? INT. TROOPER CAR. COUNTRY HIGHWAY. NIGHT. SAME TIME.

dialogues.speaker: CENTRAL VOICE
dialogues.text: (filtered) I mean they wouldn't be the first kids to go and ransack a cemetery for Spring Break.

dialogues.speaker: TROOPER WESTON
dialogues.text: What're you saying? They burned the church down too?

dialogues.speaker: CENTRAL VOICE
dialogues.text: (filtered) You wanna believe that or a hundred and fifty-year old corpse opened that car door?

dialogues.speaker: TROOPER GIDEON
dialogues.text: Say what?!

dialogues.speaker: CENTRAL VOICE
dialogues.text: (filtered) That's a ballpark on how old that powdered skin is.

dialogues.speaker: BWUMP
dialogues.text: Troopers startled.

dialogues.speaker: TROOPER GIDEON
dialogues.text: Hold on Central... A puzzled Trooper Weston rolls down the window. Rises out her seat. Head out the window to get a look up top. EXT. TROOPER CAR. COUNTRY HIGHWAY. NIGHT. SAME TIME. Trooper Weston stretches higher now, looks out over the r of the patrol car-- What she sees moves so fast in the windy night, she can't even react-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trooper Weston's body is yanked out of the car. Through t open window! Gone in one powerful, violent motion. HER SCREAM swallowed instantly as she disappears. Trooper Gideon in shock. No time to even turn his head-- WHAM!!! The large, razor sharp blade of a battle axe brea through the roof of the police car --right in front of hi face. INT. TRISH'S CAR. COUNTRY HIGHWAY. NIGHT. SAME TIME. The kids still listening to the loud song. Behind them, t patrol car swerves erratically. Something dark still ridi on top of it.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: (shouting) They're gonna be in Concert in August, downtown! EXT. TROOPER CAR. COUNTRY HIGHWAY. NIGHT. SAME TIME. Trooper Gideon's head is yanked up through a hole ripped the roof of the car. The Figure that grips him, rears back with the same razor sharp battle axe. Almost Medieval-looking. And in one neat swoop -swings it at the Trooper's head. INT. TRISH'S CAR. COUNTRY HIGHWAY. NIGHT. SAME TIME. Angle behind brother and sister: ROCK SONG BLARING AS -something big hits the roof of the car. Hard and fast. F down the windshield and off the hood. Trish slams on the brakes. Both of them clutching the dashboard. The car swings to a halt in the middle of the lane.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: What was that? Brother sticks his head out the window. Stares into the n sky. Sis looking behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Trooper vehicle angled across the two lane. It too ha made a hurried stop. No movement inside. Dark and silent. Silhouetted in the moonlight.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: What the Hell? Brother and sister look at each other. Darry's head again the window. DARRY (cont'd) Hey! Darry's voice echoes into the night. DARRY (cont'd) You okay in there? Darry gets out. Trish follows. DARRY (cont'd) Stay here. Trish looks at him. No way! Darry takes a tentative step toward the moonlit vehicle. Wishes he could see more. Trish seeing the dents on the roof of her car where the object hit. Dents with a spatter pattern. Blood.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Darry... Looks back at her. She holds up three fingers smudged wit blood.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: (screams at the car) Hey! The car's police lights flash on. Startles Darry and Tris Both squinting into them. DARRY (cont'd) Get back in the car. (turns to Trish) Get back in the car! Someone is staring out behind the wheel of that car. Peering at them, through the angry flashes of red and blu through a windshield spattered with blood...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DARRY (cont'd) Trish, get in the car! Trish paling. Turning to do this. Caught by the sight of something else. Down the road -just past the police car. A roundish thing the middle of the highway -silhouetted in moonlight. Trooper Gideon's head. Staring out at her with dead eyes. This is what hit them and rolled off the hood!

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Darry... Darry trying to make out the face in the flaring lights. eyes. So white.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Trish... The patrol car's door swings open and both of them whirl around. Back toward their own vehicle. Leaping in. Trish behind the wheel. Grapples for the stick shift in a blind panic. Darry just as fast into the passenger seat. Slams the door. A tall, powerful silhouette rises out of the patrol car. Turning instantly away from them. DARRY (cont'd) Whoa, did you see that? As it turns -its face glints for a moment in the moonligh The eyes. So white because they are just that and nothing else. No pupils or irises. A trick of the moonlight? Trish staring. The car hasn't moved. Her hand still on th stickshift. The figure walks away from them with a chillingly casual gait. His black coat flapping cape-like. And in the glare the flashing red and blue, walks back toward Gideon's hea Whistling. Whistling a tune the kids have heard in the di Jeepers, Creepers, where'd you get those Peepers? Brother and sister transfixed. Watching as with a single hand, the Figure reaches down and lifts Gideon's head by hair. Holds it then, in both hands. Looking at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holds it high. Level with its own eyes. Draws it closer. close he could be kissing it. DARRY (cont'd) (a whisper) I'm not seeing this. The Figure turns the grizzly thing around now. Does the s with the back of the head. And both kids realize what he is doing. Smelling it... DARRY (cont'd) What the Hell are we looking at, Trish? More horrid disbelief as the figure drop kicks the head - sending it high in the sky and off into the tall grass of nearby field. DARRY (cont'd) Let's get the Hell outta here... The Figure turns now. Staring back at them.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Go. Trish guns the engine and the car screams back down the highway. The dark figure watches this from afar. Still as a statue INT. TRISH'S CAR. COUNTRY HIGHWAY. NIGHT. SAME TIME.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: What is this guy? Sees her brother staring out the rear.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: What is this guy, Trish? What'd he do to those cops?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Don't know and don't wanna.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: And why didn't he do it to us? You see the way he looked at us? (looks back at her) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DARRY (cont'd) Like he's playing with us. Like running us off the road was just some kind of game. EXT. LONELY COUNTRY ROAD. NIGHT. Back at the scene of the crime, the empty patrol car, eng running, rolls slowly off the highway and into a field. The dark Figure watches only for a moment -moving away wh the car still travels pilotless deeper into the field. Before it even settles, WE CAN THE HEAR THE RUMBLE OF THE DARK VAN'S ENGINE. We leave the patrol car for a glimpse the highway when- WOOSHHH!!! The dark van rips past us down the moonlit two lane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both Trish and Darry see it at the same time. A farmhouse Down a gravel drive off the road. Lights on in the window

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: There's a phone!

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: You sure you wanna stop?!

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: I wanna get to anyone who can help us!

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: What's the next town?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: I don't know and I'm not gonna wait to find out. Trish takes the gravel drive. Jostles down the lane.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Look we just ask to use the phone, okay? We don't freak these people out. The house comes into more detail. Old and sagging. But it warmly lit windows like a beacon. Of safety. Sanity.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: We don't wanna scare 'em. We just wanna call for help. Headlights etching the overgrown garden that is the front yard. An ancient pick-up to one side. In the center of th overgrowth, a sagging thing scarcely presuming to be a scarecrow.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Too spooky. Trish looks at him. He's serious.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Too spooky. Let's just get the Hell outta here. At the outskirts of the yard, a plastic sunflower ticks a in a night breeze as the car comes to a halt.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: It's pretty run down. Hope they have a phone.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
