dialogues.text: I hope they have a gun.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: I hope they don't. She opens the door. Gets out. Darry too. Their first look to the highway. Empty. For as far as the eye can see. KER-CLINK! THE DISTINCT SOUND OF A RIFLE BEING COCKED tur the kids quickly toward the house.

dialogues.speaker: CAT LADY
dialogues.text: Who are you? A WOMAN'S RASPY VOICE. From a silhouette behind the scree door. A blue-black rifle barrel glinting in its hands.

dialogues.speaker: CAT LADY
dialogues.text: I said who are you?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Patricia James. This is my brother Darry.

dialogues.speaker: CAT LADY
dialogues.text: What 'cha want?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: A telephone?

dialogues.speaker: CAT LADY
dialogues.text: Ain't got one. The kids look at each other. A whispered aside:

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: You know it's not too late to keep driving and not stop ‘till we see people.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: What do you think she is?

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Crazy?

dialogues.speaker: CAT LADY
dialogues.text: Whatcha' need it for?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Someone's been killed. A police officer. Down the road. The screen door opens now and THE CAT LADY steps out. A strange looking woman of fifty or so. Very intense around eyes. MEOWWW...

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: We just came from there- Sounds of cats at her feet. She pushes a couple back inside the screen with a foot. A foot wearing a fuzz pink slipper. Darry staring down at the felines. Remembers instantly th strange phone call at the diner. Did you see the cats yet The Woman gun still

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: It's a ways back. You can't see it from here. levels her eyes at the two. Judging them. Her shot clenched tightly.

dialogues.speaker: CAT LADY
dialogues.text: All right one call. (off their looks) But be quick, my babies they don't like strangers. Trisha just stares at the old woman. She has children?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trish climbs the porch steps. Sees Darry still staring do at the cats inside the door. Trisha doesn't understand. Makes a face that tells him to hurry up! He starts forward. Cat Lady opens the screen fo them -again holding one feline inside with a fuzzy slippe

dialogues.speaker: CAT LADY
dialogues.text: Careful. I don't let ‘em out after dark.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: How many cats do you have?

dialogues.speaker: CAT LADY
dialogues.text: More than a couple, I'm afraid. INT. CAT LADY'S HOUSE. NIGHT. SAME TIME. Trish and Darry halt instantly as they step inside: The living room is covered with cats. All kinds. All shap All sizes. There must be forty of them in the living room alone.

dialogues.speaker: CAT LADY
dialogues.text: Phone's there by the love seat. The Cat Lady shuts the front door and steps past them. St the rifle in a closet. Trish covers her nose with a hand. Makes a face at Darry. smell is terrible.

dialogues.speaker: CAT LADY
dialogues.text: Policeman killed you say? Darry still caught in an uneasy trance. That phone call. you see the cats yet?

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Let's get out of here. Trish looks at him like he's crazy. The Cat Lady turns to them now. Trish lowers her hands from her nose.

dialogues.speaker: CAT LADY
dialogues.text: People think they can drive like maniacs ‘round here. Cops too, damned fools. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAT LADY (cont'd) Just a bunch of punk kids with badges and guns if you ask me. Trish moves to the phone. It too surrounded by felines. Scatters a few as she reaches down and lifts the receiver

dialogues.speaker: CAT LADY
dialogues.text: Who is that making a call on your telephone, hmm? Who is that? She is asking the one cat that remains. Sniffing Trisha a she dials.

dialogues.speaker: CAT LADY
dialogues.text: That's the thing about cats. (off Darry's look) Can whiff a bad egg a mile away. Can't they Tomfoolery? Darry realizes she is referring to the cat that now rubs itself against his legs.

dialogues.speaker: CAT LADY
dialogues.text: Oh he likes you. Lookee that. He wants you to pick him up. Darry nods. Tries to press out a polite smile.

dialogues.speaker: CAT LADY
dialogues.text: Don't be afraid. Darry bends. Pets the cat's head.

dialogues.speaker: CAT LADY
dialogues.text: Go on! Big boy like you's not afraid of a little pussy is he? He regards her. Did she just say that? Must mean somethin else. He lifts the cat into his arms. Pets its head.

dialogues.speaker: CAT LADY
dialogues.text: There you go. (steps away) Big thing like you can't go through his life being afraid of a sweet little pussy. She winks at him this time -lecherously. Darry swallows. means what she means.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Yes, Patrica James. We just left Trentdale with a police escort.

dialogues.speaker: PHONE VOICE
dialogues.text: (filtered) Are you calling the Trentdale County sheriff's department?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: I thought I was.

dialogues.speaker: CAT LADY
dialogues.text: Trentdale's the next County over. You're in Poho County now, you crossed the County line.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Look I don't know exactly where the house is I'm calling from- She looks to the Cat Lady to tell her the address, but sh shaking her head adamantly.

dialogues.speaker: CAT LADY
dialogues.text: Don't bring the cops out here! They try and bust my ass every year with their zoning crap! (to Darry) Try and tell people how many cats a person can have!

dialogues.speaker: PHONE VOICE
dialogues.text: (filtered) You said you needed to report an emergency? But the VOICE IS SUDDENLY SWALLOWED BY ANGRY STATIC ON TH LINE. Trish holds the phone away from her ear. Cat Lady and Darry watching. She clicks the clicker. Puts phone back to her ear. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Your phone just went dead. She is looking at her brother and thinking the worse. The Cat Lady marches over to hear for herself. Puts the p to her ear as the lights go out all over the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darry, Trish, the Cat Lady and her many fuzzy minions suddenly plunged into darkness. Darry rushing to the window -the cat still in his arms. EXT. FARMHOUSE. NIGHT. SAME TIME. Out in the overgrown garden, the plastic sunflower again clicks to a stop in the silent, moonlit yard. INT. FARMHOUSE. NIGHT. SAME TIME.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: There's nobody out there. Then every cat in the place lifts its head in unison. Forty pairs of cat's eyes staring toward the front window Trish and Darry watching this. As growing from every corn of the room, are the wicked hisses of frightened cats everywhere. The cat in Darry's arms freaks -clawing and thrashing to itself.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Ouch!!! He winces in pain as THE ANIMAL YOWLS and hits the floor running. Cat Lady rushing to the front window. Trish and Darry with her. The overgrown yard is dark with inky shadows. Her distres scarecrow standing in the middle of it. MORE CATS HISSING. Fur standing on end. Fangs bared. What is out there, these animals do not like it.

dialogues.speaker: CAT LADY
dialogues.text: I'll be Goddamned! The Cat Lady storming back to the closet for her rifle. T kids looking after her.

dialogues.speaker: CAT LADY
dialogues.text: That's not my scarecrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shot rolling slowly toward: The inky silhouette of the scarecrow. It is larger than we remember it. And better dressed. In a long black coat... The Figure stands before the old hay-stuffed thing-creati single silhouette. Cutting a tall, dark shadow against the starry night sky. with eyes we can barely discern. Eyes that might not belong to any human thing... INT. FARMHOUSE. NIGHT. SAME TIME. The cats are going berserk. Two of them topple the phone table. Others run in confused circles around the couch. Several scramble over the base of the floor lamp. Send it its side with a loud crash. Still others are scaling the drapes --clawing their way toward the ceiling... The Cat Lady watches puzzled by her felines.

dialogues.speaker: CAT LADY
dialogues.text: Who the Hell is that? Cocks the rifle loudly and throws open the front door. Le the rifle at the scarecrow.

dialogues.speaker: CAT LADY
dialogues.text: You gotta ‘bout ten seconds to get your ass outta my yard! The Scarecrow/Figure stands. Continues to stare in at the Silhouetted in the moonlight.

dialogues.speaker: CAT LADY
dialogues.text: Don't think I'm gonna tell you twice. It's voice. Strange. A raspy whisper.

dialogues.speaker: THE CREATURE
dialogues.text: My children. Trish and Darry exchange glances.

dialogues.speaker: CAT LADY
dialogues.text: What? A chilling whisper in the night:

dialogues.speaker: THE CREATURE
dialogues.text: I've come for my children. Trish and Darry frozen by these words. The old woman turn look at them. When the Figure bolts toward the house! Cat Lady whirls about. Fires. KA-BLAM!!!

dialogues.speaker: AT THE MOMENT OF IMPACT.
dialogues.text: The Figure is gone. Vanished into thin air. Unless... Cat Lady, Darry and Trish crowd the doorway trying to see out. Darry's gaze caught by something high. Catches a terrifying glimpse of it scrambling up the fron the house. Like some horrible caped insect. As if gravity simply did not exist.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: What in the Holy- His cutting whispers turns the women to him. Stares at th in shock. KER-KRASH!!!! A WINDOW BREAKS SOMEWHERE UPSTAIRS. All thr whirl around. Staring up at the ceiling. Then cats are dropping past the front windows. Dropping d into the yard. From the second story? They land on their feet. Scurrying off into the night.... Trish and Darry look at each other with mounting panic... Cat Lady looks to brother and sis. What the Hell did you bring into my house?

dialogues.speaker: WITH THE SOUND FROM ABOVE, OF ONE CAT CLEARLY ATTACKING -
dialogues.text: Cat lady storms toward the stairs brandishing her rifle.

dialogues.speaker: CAT LADY
dialogues.text: Get away from my babies you sons-of-a-bitches!

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Don't! Darry charges for her. Grabs the old woman.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Don't go up there!

dialogues.speaker: CAT LADY
dialogues.text: Goddammit!!!

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Leave now!! With us!

dialogues.speaker: CAT LADY
dialogues.text: Goddammit!!! (screaming up the stairs) Don't you hurt my babies- She catches Darry in the groin with a nasty kick. HE YELP Crumples as she charges up the steps.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Darry!!! Sis hurries to him. Starts dragging him toward the front door. She just wants out. Wants to go!

dialogues.speaker: CAT LADY
dialogues.text: I'1l blow your Goddamned head off- But at the top of the stairs, the Cat Lady is suddenly wrenched off her feet! The kids watch as her fuzzy pink slippers disappear from view. Straight up.

dialogues.speaker: THEY HEAR HER GASP ONLY ONCE. NOW A CHOKED, GARGLING SOUN
dialogues.text: The kids staring up at the top step where here feet vanis The cats are in absolute frenzy. Some baring fangs in the direction of the stairs, others climbing the old drapes o the place in a frantic panic to get out. To get away. Trish dashing back toward the front door with injured Dar Halted by the sight of those slippers -slipping now, slow back into view on the top step. Something just out of sight at the top of the stairs is holding her there. Feet dangling. One slipper falls off. Darry approaches in horror. Wants to see up those stairs. Wants to see just what the Hell this thing is... At the foot of the stairs he looks up. Can see her body hanging there, lifeless -held in the iron grip of the lon coated Figure --pulling the old woman into him as if she a doll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And sniffing. Sniffing her. The same way he did the offic decapitated head. Darry throws a look to his sister: at the door, hand on t knob -frozen by her brother's paling expression. Darry looks back: the Figure takes another long inhale an then peers around the dangling old woman. Out of the shad and down the stairs --directly at him. For the first time Darry sees its face clearly: Though the features are human. The glaring blind whites o the eyes -where pupils should be- give a much more terrif impression. Not of something human but of something else. Something dark and powerful that only wears the guise of human. ...Something utterly horrible and without conscien It stares at him a chilling moment longer. Again its rasp voice whispering from its lips.

dialogues.speaker: THE CREATURE
dialogues.text: She doesn't smell too good, Darry. Darry bolts. He is to the door so fast he turns the knob before his sister can. EXT. FARMHOUSE. NIGHT. SAME TIME. Trish and Darry blasting outside. A flurry of fleeing cat also pour down the porch steps with them, spilling into t front yard. The kids scramble to their car. Trish flies behind the wheel and turns the key. Engine no turning over. Darry's eyes scanning the dark face of the farmhouse. MOR COMMOTION INSIDE. CATS SCREAMING. Trish with the key. Grinding the ignition. It starts.

dialogues.speaker: POWERFUL SHOWER OF GLASS AND WOOD.
dialogues.text: The Creature leaps into the night. Darry and Trish watching it. Some kind of nightmare strea across the white of the half moon and then dropping down. Down into the yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impossibly it lands on its feet. Crouched low to the grou Like some horrible beast ready to pounce. Putting its sites -those horrible blank eyes- on the kids

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Go! Go! Go! The car squeals out of the yard, down the gravel drive an back toward the highway. Darry watching as the Creature sprints across the yard. Disappears in the darkness as the farmhouse gets smaller smaller...

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: You see his face? Trish grapples the wheel. Taking the dark highway as fast she is able. INT. TRISH'S CAR. COUNTRY HIGHWAY. NIGHT. SAME TIME.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Come on Trish, you see his face?! A sign flashes by: RATLROAD CROSSING 1/2 Mile

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: I know you saw it Goddamn it-

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: (matching his tone) One freaky thing at a time, alright?! Silence. Both staring ahead now. Darry whispering his new mantra.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: He was wearing a mask. (looks to her) Trish? (off her look) He was wearing a mask.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: You have to say it too.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: He was wearing a mask.

dialogues.speaker: WOOOONNNNKKKKKK
dialogues.text: The van is close -its headlights blasting the interior of car. Startling them as much as the horn.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: What is this guy trying to do?!!

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Darry! Trish has her own problem: up ahead The railroad crossing lights flashing, automated arms lowering AND BELLS ARE RINGING LOUDLY. Darry out the back squinting into the blaring headlights.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Darry!!

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Gun it, you can make it!!! The van is gaining. The train nearing. BELLS CLANGING THE WARNING.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Maybe down the tracks!

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: He'll kill us!

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: I can maybe get to the conductor!

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Are you crazy?!!!

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: You gotta do this, Trish!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van is all over both lanes, weaving back and forth. BLASTING THAT HIDEOUS, TAUNTING HORN.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: He wants us to! Darry stares at her. She knows this?

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Trish faster! !

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: (emphatically) We are going to die!!!!

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Just do it!!! THE TRAIN HORN BLARES ITS FINAL WARNING. Trish slams the pedal to the metal and takes her sedan blasting through the barrier arms. It lurches across the track as the train roars at them li an iron beast. They fly over the tracks. The train just nicking their re bumper. Sends them spinning. Brother and sister collectively trying to grab the wheel. Spinning out of control while the train cuts them off fro the van. The van which slams on its brakes and swerves dangerously close to the tracks and the train. On the other side, the sedan stops spinning. Trish trying bearings. Darry still has his hands on the wheel with her

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Let go of the wheel! Darry looks behind him. Nothing but the train CLANKING NOISILY over the tracks.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: We gotta move! Trish grabs the gearshift but it won't budge. Darry sees

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Something's wrong.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Don't say that. CLANK! CLANK! CLANK! The train's cars fly by -their only barrier from the van and their predator.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: The gears are sticking-

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: (jaw tightening) Unstick ‘em, Trish!

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: What do you want me to do?! Trish and Darry both grapple the stick shift. Can't wrest the car into first gear.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Goddammit! !

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: You're gonna break it! Not seeing, as we do, something black shooting into the s from the other side of the train.

dialogues.speaker: HARD. ROCKING IT VIOLENTLY.
dialogues.text: Bro and sis stare out the back: The Creature is crouched there -staring in at them with those horrible eyes.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: He jumped over the train, Trish... Trish grinding that stickshift -trying with all her might

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: He jumped over the train, Trish! C1UNK! The car's transmission falls into gear and Trish g the engine. The car lurches ahead --jolting the Creature. It clutches sides of the car as she speeds forward. Darry in a stunned, numbed kind of shock. Trish dips onto the shoulder of the road. Trying to make ride rough. Swings across both lanes. Weaving erratically

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trying desperately to lose the thing on the trunk. Trish slams on the brakes. The car swings sideways violen Finally flinging it into the air. The kids watch as he flails into space. Coat flapping aro him -like a giant bat who has suddenly lost its equilibri Hitting the asphalt hard and rolling and skidding. Things falling out of his coat as he does. The battle axe CLANGING noisily on the ground and another insidious looking knife, bouncing on the asphalt with a couple of others --like the Creature, coming to an abrupt violent halt.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: What the Hell are those? Trish just staring at the motionless heap of black under moonlight. The train's final car moves down the tracks behind them. Revealing the dark van just beyond the flashing railroad lights. Brother and sister staring ahead at the lifeless heap. TH

dialogues.speaker: TRAIN CROSSING CEASE.
dialogues.text: Silence now. Only the sound of their breathing in the car until Darry's whisper.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Hit him. She looks at her little brother.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Hit him, Trish. (off her look) Hard. She looks out the windshield. That lifeless mass sprawled the highway.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Do it! She opens her mouth to respond -when the Creature's head rises. It is staring at them. Those blind, ugly eyes burn out toward them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trish slams the pedal to the metal. Corrects the position the car and rockets forward with as much speed as she can build. The Creature's face caught in the glare of the headlights WHAM! Trish slams into it hard. The car's wheels pummel it savagely. Both kids grimacing

dialogues.speaker: TIRES....
dialogues.text: Trish stops now. Looks back at her handiwork. The cape has flapped over the Creature's head and its lifeless figure, complete with tire tracks, lays a little flatter on the two-lane. Brother and sister exchange glances.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: You think he's dead?

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: They never are.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Right. Trish throws the car in reverse and speeds back at the lifeless shape. KER-POP! A sickeningly distinct sound as the tires roll o its legs this time. Trish comes to a halt behind it. Staring ahead into the h beams: there can be no mistaking this thing is flattened! On the asphalt, at the end of one coat sleeve, a hand lay crushed. Tire treads over it. Even bones crushed and flak like Greek pastry. Blowing away now. The whole hand blowing away. Dust in th wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In fact, LOTS of powder is blowing out from under that bl coat... The kids watch in awe: Have they crushed this thing to du

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Let's get outta here.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: I don't know how much farther this car's gonna go.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Far enough. Trish guns the engine again -a final trouncing for the Th in the road as they roar over it and speed into the dista INT. POHO COUNTY SHERIFF'S DEPT. NIGHT. AN HOUR LATER. Trish on a payphone in the empty lobby. Darry next to her in. These kids have been through Hell and they look it.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: It's the Poho County Sheriff's Department. It's right off the main highway about twenty miles before Trentdale. I am serious mom, we're okay. The car, I don't know. Tell dad we may have to have it towed someplace. Darry turns away for a moment. Caught by something on an opposite wall. A long bulletin board of missing persons. An ocean of fac Men, women and children. Some of the headings read: HAVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you. See you when you get here. Darry stares ahead numbly. All the faces staring back at

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Hey... (off his look) They're on their way. Be here in about an hour.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: An hour and a half if mom drives.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Never thought I'd be so glad to see mom and dad. (looks to her) Actually looking forward to one of dad's "What in the name of God did you do now?" She smiles. In this look between them is a rare glimpse o their true love for each other.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: We will do it you know? We will get home.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: (recognizes her own words being used mockingly) Shut up! In from the night steps JEZELLE GAY HARTMAN. Heavy set. L forties. Sweet, plump face. In Capri pants, sneakers and sweatshirt, she is a woman on a mission.

dialogues.speaker: DESK SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Jezelle. The DESK SERGEANT is not happy to see her. She walks righ past him.

dialogues.speaker: DESK SERGEANT
dialogues.text: What can we do for you tonight... The Sergeant out from his desk. Moves after her.

dialogues.speaker: DESK SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Jezelle! Jezelle steps up to Trish and Darry. Studies them.

dialogues.speaker: DESK SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Come on Jezz’, they been through a lot, okay? She extends a plump hand. A tiny hint of a drawl in her h voice.

dialogues.speaker: JEZELLE
dialogues.text: You the kids, then? Darry and Trish, you them?

dialogues.speaker: DESK SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Jez' Goddammit-

dialogues.speaker: JEZELLE
dialogues.text: (shaking Trish’s hand) Jezelle Gay Hartman, how do you do?

dialogues.speaker: DESK SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Jezelle’s maybe a little confused about what’s going on down here tonight-

dialogues.speaker: JEZELLE
dialogues.text: Less confused than Jerry here would like to think. (shakes Darry’s hand) If you were talking to his Captain? Captain John Develle who is off duty tonight? He'd tell you different.

dialogues.speaker: DESK SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Jezelle likes to think she’s the resident psychic around here. Behind her back, the Sergeant signals to the kids that sh not to be taken seriously.

dialogues.speaker: DESK SERGEANT
dialogues.text: She helped us on a missing persons a few years ago-

dialogues.speaker: JEZELLE
dialogues.text: You think you could just let me talk to these kids for five minutes by myself?! THE PHONE AT THE DESK CHIRPING INCESSANTLY. The Sergeant moves to answer it.

dialogues.speaker: DESK SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Go home, turn that Goddamned police scanner off and go to bed.

dialogues.speaker: JEZELLE
dialogues.text: And you go do something useful, you got officers missing!

dialogues.speaker: DESK SERGEANT
dialogues.text: I mean it Jezelle, leave ‘em alone. Trish and Darry left staring at the woman.

dialogues.speaker: JEZELLE
dialogues.text: You don’t have to believe I’m psychic. But I can tell you something these cops haven't. (off their look) That dust they got off your car back at Delroy’s? It tested as human skin over a hundred and fifty years old. Darry and Trish listen to her.

dialogues.speaker: JEZELLE
dialogues.text: That didn’t come in a dream. I heard it on the police scanner. I got more to tell you and I come a long way to do it.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: You know I’m really not sure we should be talking to anybody right now-

dialogues.speaker: JEZELLE
dialogues.text: I know what it is. Her voice a sudden and urgent whisper.

dialogues.speaker: JEZELLE
dialogues.text: I know what’s chasing you. She has their full attention now.

dialogues.speaker: JEZELLE
dialogues.text: You found a lot of bodies. (off Darry’s incredulous look) Down in that cellar. I saw ‘em too. (swallows ) You see the cats yet? I saw you with cats too. Lots of cats-

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: You called. At the diner, that was you.

dialogues.speaker: JEZELLE
dialogues.text: I saw those bodies just like you did. That poor boy with the stitches all down him... I saw you there with him.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: JEZELLE
dialogues.text: Dreamed it. (waits for a response) I dream a lot of things. The woman's self-assuredness is dissolving. She stares at them with eyes flickering with fear and sadness.

dialogues.speaker: JEZELLE
dialogues.text: Those bodies down there. You found its house of pain. Darry doesn’t know why but his blood runs cold.

dialogues.speaker: JEZELLE
dialogues.text: I don’t know how I know that, I just... know that’s what it likes to call it.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: What ...likes to call it?

dialogues.speaker: JEZELLE
dialogues.text: It’s got a whole lotta names. From a whole lotta different times and places. Eater of the Dead... That’s the one that keeps coming to me.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Eater of the... (off her nod) What does that mean, it eats people?

dialogues.speaker: JEZELLE
dialogues.text: It has to. (off their stunned looks) It has incredible power. That’s how it stays that way. How it's lived so long. Trish tries to leave. Brother holds her arm. Won’t let he

dialogues.speaker: JEZELLE
dialogues.text: I don't like having this in my head. I don't like knowing this and not knowing why I do... (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEZELLE (cont'd) Every twenty-third Spring. For twenty-three days. It gets to eat. Whatever it needs. It eats eyes so it can see. It eats lungs so it can breathe...

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: (standing, pointedly) I’m gonna be sick. Darry would you come and help me throw up, please?

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Look this thing has had chances to kill us, and it didn't. This makes Jezelle even more uncomfortable. What she now to say.

dialogues.speaker: JEZELLE
dialogues.text: (swallows, her eyes dampening) It's very particular. Only wants ...certain parts from certain bodies. One of you has something it might like. (Darry swallows) It won't stop following until it knows for sure.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: By trying to run us off the road?!

dialogues.speaker: JEZELLE
dialogues.text: (shakes her head 'yes', her voice a cutting whisper) It needs to scare you. (find's Trish's eyes) There's something in fear. Something it can smell. Brother and sister stare at her.

dialogues.speaker: JEZELLE
dialogues.text: Makes it easier for it. To know if there's anything ina person it might ..like.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Like?

dialogues.speaker: JEZELLE
dialogues.text: Wants.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Wants?

dialogues.speaker: JEZELLE
dialogues.text: +...to eat.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Oh fuck you! EXT. POHO COUNTY SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT. NIGHT. SAME TIME. Many off duty patrol cars. TWO OFFICERS just sitting down theirs. Coffee cups in hand. Engine turns over and they r out of the lot. While at the opposite end, an old dark van rolls into vie Its familiar license plate vibrating slightly with the ro idle of the engine:

dialogues.speaker: BEATNGU
dialogues.text: Now we think about the other way this plate could be read Eating You.....

dialogues.speaker: JEZELLE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I don't know what it is exactly. If it's a Demon or a Devil or just some hungry thing from a wicked place somewhere in time. The van door swings open. Engine still running as one of Creature's feet sets down on the asphalt. It's black shoe marred with a tire track.

dialogues.speaker: JEZELLE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I just know it's been doing this for a lot longer than a hundred and fifty years. And it is not gonna stop. Coming after you or anyone else it wants to. The other leg swings out awkwardly. Out of a tattered pan leg the foot hangs -barely attached. Only by a length of flesh and a torn sock...

dialogues.speaker: JEZELLE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: ‘Cause once it has the scent of something it likes...? With this horrid handicap, the Creature starts a grizzly, almost comical limp across the shadowy parking lot....

dialogues.speaker: JEZELLE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It can't. It can't stop. INT. POHO COUNTY SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT. NIGHT. SAME TIME. Jezelle pleading with Darry and Trish. Her voice an urgen whisper:

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: And you don't know how you know that, you just do, right?! Jezelle stares at her. Eyes welling. Looks so sad. Like h heart is breaking. Like there is something else she knows Something too terrible for her to say.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: What? Jezelle shakes her head no. Can't speak it.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: What else? Darry takes her by her plump arms. Forces her to look at

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Goddammit you told us this much now what else?!

dialogues.speaker: JEZELLE
dialogues.text: (the quietest whisper) I told you. Jeepers Creepers.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: I heard it. (off Jezelle’s look) At the diner. Nothing happened.

dialogues.speaker: JEZELLE
dialogues.text: No. It’s playing on an old phonograph. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEZELLE (cont'd) (tries to sing in her frighted whisper) Jeepers Creepers, where'd you get those peepers? Darry and Trish looking at each other. This lady has real gone over the edge.

dialogues.speaker: JEZELLE
dialogues.text: (can barely say it) I hear it playing while one of you is screaming. (her eyes find Trish) Screaming down in the dark somewhere. Screaming the last scream you'll ever- SUDDENLY LIGHTS OUT! THE HALL PLUNGED INTO DARKNESS. The Desk Sergeant lifts the phone.

dialogues.speaker: DESK SERGEANT
dialogues.text: We got lights out up here. The facility has come to an abrupt standstill. Trish, Dar and Jezelle, eyes toward the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: (a whisper) It's gone. We ran it over until there was nothing left. (meets Jezelle's eyes in the dark) We killed it.

dialogues.speaker: JEZELLE
dialogues.text: It's eaten too many hearts for it's own to ever stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A flashlight blares out the dark as OFFICER TIM MCCURRY starts the long walk down a shadowy row of cells.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER MCCURRY
dialogues.text: Heads up gentlemen. His flashlight falls over the first cell. Two bodies slee in upper and lower bunks.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER MCCURRY
dialogues.text: I said heads up, gentlemen. Show me some skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The INMATE in the upper bunk stares groggily into the gla of the flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: INMATE
dialogues.text: What the Hell's wrong with you, man?

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER MCCURRY
dialogues.text: We have a black out gentlemen. That means emergency head count. (drops his beam to the lower bunk) Lower bunk show me some skin. An angry hand juts out from under the blanket -middle fin extended. The Officer moves onto the next cell.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER MCCURRY
dialogues.text: Head count gentlemen... UPPER AND LOWER BUNKMATES peer into the beam. Officer McC moves to the next. Stops when he hears A SOUND. ..-A WET SOUND. McCurry follows it. Moves quickly past several more cells THE SOUND HAS GONE FROM SLURPING TO CRUNCHING.... He is at the end of hall now. Approaching the last and darkest cell. The flashlight falling over something McCur cannot believe: The bars to this cell have been bent outward and apart. McCurry fumbles with his free hand to get his service pis out of his holster. Takes another step: The man in the cell freezes when the beam of light hits h Dressed in a long black coat. Squatting over something on floor. McCurry looks down: The body of AN INMATE lies in a pool of dark blood. At th end of his right leg -the foot has been chewed completely off... McCurry in shock. The Figure, ignoring the Officer's presence now, returns his work. Bows his head. Suddenly thrashing it back and forth. The lifeless inmate rocking with the same violent motions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCurry moving fast now. Leaps before the cell. Levels hi pistol. The Figure's head drops back. McCurry halted by that horrible WET, CRUNCHING SOUND as t inmate's arm falls into view: His hand gone. A bloody stump adding more crimson to the floor. McCurry cocks his pistol. The sound is loud and causes th Figure to turn. Slowly. Until he is staring up at McCurry past the gun barrel. McCurry paralyzed: The Creature's white eyes glaring up a him. Its mouth and chin a bloody mess... McCurry should have fired by now. Too perplexed and horri at what he is staring at... THWAMM!!! It moves so fast, McCurry only feels the bars o the cell slamming into his face -and service pistol flyin out of his hand with the impact. He has been grappled, in a blurring moment of speed, thro the bars of the cell by the Creature's one good hand. The other hand: non-existent. Just an empty sleeve as he holds Officer McCurry against those bars. Nose to nose. Surveying the Officer. Those malevolent whi eyes staring into him.

dialogues.speaker: THE SOUND OF TRICKLING. SOMETHING TRICKLING ONTO THE GROU
dialogues.text: Both cop and Creature look down at the Creature's empty sleeve. A grayish powder trickles out of it. And with it, a new hand. Drops down from inside the sleev and splays its fingers. Replacing the one pummelled into by the tire of Trish's car. The Creature takes McCurry's head in both hands now. Lean in. Close. Closer... And sniffs. Sniffs him. Leans in now. Inhales him. Savori his scent. -To the Officer's horror and surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We cannot see clearly what is happening at the dark end o the corridor -just McCurry's arms and legs flailing madly HE SCREAMS. INT. POHO COUNTY SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT. NIGHT. SAME TIME. Emergency lights flickering on. Tiny pools of light from corners of the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: DESK SERGEANT
dialogues.text: About Goddamned time. Trish, Darry and Jezelle staring up at them. Lots of acti suddenly. Officers everywhere moving around in the semi-d

dialogues.speaker: DESK SERGEANT
dialogues.text: All right we are going to a lock down situation, people. That means everybody sit tight, and don't move unless somebody wearing a badge tells you to.

dialogues.speaker: JEZELLE
dialogues.text: He's here. Trish and Darry look almost angry at her for having said this. She regards them. Nods in a chilling affirmation.

dialogues.speaker: DESK SERGEANT
dialogues.text: You kids wanna come with me? All three whirl around, startled by the Sergeant, suddenl behind them in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: DESK SERGEANT
dialogues.text: We're gonna put you in a room down the hall here. With Jezelle in tow, down the dark hall.

dialogues.speaker: DESK SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Uh-uh. (points a thumb at Jezelle) Not you, lady Sherlock. (calls out) Someone escort Jezelle here back to the big, blue Winnebago she's no doubt blocking the driveway with. Two Officers step up to escort her away.

dialogues.speaker: JEZELLE
dialogues.text: (full of ire) These kids are still in trouble! I might still be able to help ‘em-

dialogues.speaker: DESK SERGEANT
dialogues.text: I told you: outta here!

dialogues.speaker: JEZELLE
dialogues.text: You don't see what's about to happen-

dialogues.speaker: DESK SERGEANT
dialogues.text: (to the Officers) Let's get Ms. Hartman out of here, please. The Officers start to back her up. She looks to Trish and Darry with the most frightened eyes.

dialogues.speaker: JEZELLE
dialogues.text: He's gonna find you in here! He's gonna find you ‘less you get out-

dialogues.speaker: DESK SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Alright now Goddammit knock it off!! The Officers take her by the arms now.

dialogues.speaker: JEZELLE
dialogues.text: Get away from me!

dialogues.speaker: DESK SERGEANT
dialogues.text: I swear I will lock you up, Jezz'!

dialogues.speaker: JEZELLE
dialogues.text: (looks to Darry) You believe me?!! Her frightened eyes burning out at him.

dialogues.speaker: JEZELLE
dialogues.text: You believe what I said?! Darry panicking. Doesn't want to believe. Moves toward he she is ushered toward the exit.

dialogues.speaker: JEZELLE
dialogues.text: I didn't know if it would help but I had to tell you what I knew!

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Are your dreams ever wrong?! Jezelle just staring at him.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Your dreams, are they ever wrong?!! Darry unnerved by the horrible sadness on her face. DARRY (cont'd) You know, don’t you?

dialogues.speaker: JEZELLE
dialogues.text: You have to get out of here!

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: You know who dies! You know which one of us!

dialogues.speaker: JEZELLE
dialogues.text: Don’t let them lock you anywhere in this building-

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: You know but you don’t have the guts to tell us! Jezelle looking helpless. Eyes frozen on Darry.

dialogues.speaker: GUNSHOTS
dialogues.text: CRACKLING OVER A NEARBY OFFICER’S WALKIE.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER ONE
dialogues.text: (filtered) Up top -this is the basement. We have a 10-34. I repeat a 10-
The officer takes his walkie off his belt. The Desk Serge hurries to listen in. Lots of commotion on the other end.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER ONE
dialogues.text: (filtered) Anybody on groundlevel!

dialogues.speaker: DESK SERGEANT
dialogues.text: (grabs the walkie) Kribbs, Go ahead!

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER ONE
dialogues.text: (filtered) We got a situation down here Sarge'!

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER ONE
dialogues.text: (filtered) Its headed toward you! Up the rear stairs! You copy?! Trish and Darry exchanging looks. Impossible. Can’t be hi

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER ONE
dialogues.text: (filtered) Coming up the rear stairwell! Pandemonium in the dark. Officers racing toward the end o the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: DESK SERGEANT
dialogues.text: (to Trish and Darry) Stay here! He runs back down the hall -past Jezelle staring at them.

dialogues.speaker: JEZELLE
dialogues.text: We gotta get you outta here. She moves fast for a big woman. Heading down the dark corridor. Away from the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: JEZELLE
dialogues.text: Come on I said! They move with her. Darry taking a final look back at the lobby where Officers now hug the walls. Staring down a corridor that ends in the rear stairwell. The Sergeant stares with the others at the dark stairwell Illuminated by a single dollop of light from one of the emergency overheads. Four cops flank the walls before it. Weapons drawn. The Sergeant hisses an urgent whisper into his walkie.

dialogues.speaker: DESK SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Somebody talk to me down there!

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER ONE
dialogues.text: (filtered) We have one inmate and an officer down! More officers responding. Running out of the dark. The Sergeant waves them back.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER ONE
dialogues.text: (filtered) Ramirez too, he’s hurt bad. Son-of-a-bitch tried to take a bite out of him!

dialogues.speaker: DESK SERGEANT
dialogues.text: What?! A shadow falling over the stairwell. Someone headed up th stairs. MORE GUN SHOTS. Flashes from below etching the shadow whi suddenly flickers up the wall and out of view. Officers staring puzzled. Where did this guy go?

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER ONE
dialogues.text: (filtered) This guy is wearing something ‘cause we cannot take him down! Copy? We cannot take him down! They can hear something moving. Getting closer. Guns aime down those dark stairs. One of the Officers, DANE, looks to the Sergeant. Gets a Dane moves forward. Hugging the wall. Very close to the stairwell now. Jumps aside the doorway. Braves a look down. Nothing on t stairs. Hears something in the stillness... A sniffing sound. Somewhere in the dark. They can all hea it. Puzzled by it. Down the stairs? Officer Dane looks back at the Sergeant. seeing what everyone else does behind him: THE CREATURE’S HEAD DROPPING INTO VIEW FROM ABOVE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanging upside down just inside the stairwell doorway! Th officers swing their guns to this horrible visage when -

dialogues.speaker: PLOSSHH
dialogues.text: OFFICER DANE’S FACE ERUPTS IN SHOCK! SPRAYED SUDDENLY WIT CRIMSON. HIS CHEST HAS THE CREATURE’S HAND STICKING OUT O IT. HE HAS PUNCHED RIGHT THROUGH IT! In the Creature's horrib hand -THE OFFICER'S STILL-PUMPING HEART! The Creature swings back up out of view. Taking his blood parcel with him. The men staring ahead in shock. Dane just stares wide-eyed with the hole in his chest. SLURPING AND GARGLING SOUNDS as the unseen Creature inges what onlookers don't want to believe he could be. The heartless Officer tries to say something now but can' manage it. Falls back and tumbles down the stairs. The Desk Sergeant and his men are the color of chalk as t regard each other in the terrible, silent shadows of the hall.... KER-OOSSSHHHHH! !!!! The ceiling over the doorway erupts. Plaster and dust flying everywhere as the Creature blasts through the wall and onto his feet before the startled onlookers. He is instantly moving. Stepping forward in long powerful strides through the dust and the confusion --directly at Officers and their guns. Everyone opens fire -bullets ripping through the Creature

dialogues.speaker: HIM.
dialogues.text: The men watch in horror as the Officer flails back and crashes to the floor. The Creature reaches out. Yanks another off his feet. Twitches and convulses as the grip cuts off his air. The Creature still moving. With his other hand, grips the Officer by the groin. Holds him out now. A human shield a strides down the dark corridor watching the other Officer retreat in shock and confusion. Two Officers behind him, running at him. One has his pist leveled. The other screaming at him not to shoot.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER TWO
dialogues.text: No!!! Charges ahead himself. A flying tackle at the Creature’s back. But it is like hitting a mountain. He hits hard and hangs on -grappling the Creature around the neck. The Creature still moving. Not even slowed. One man hangi on his back and one he still holds in front of him. Others retreating. Scared. What the Hell is this thing?!

dialogues.speaker: DESK SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Goddammit !!! The Sergeant remains in the middle of the hall -his revol aimed at the approaching nightmare. The Officer on the Creature’s back starts to pistol whip Desperately trying to stop him. But in a swift and viciou move, it swings around -slamming its back into the neares wall. Slamming it hard. The Officer with it. The plaster on the wall cracks with the impact. The Officer's eyes go wide as he spits blood. He collapse the floor in a heap as the Creature continues on. His hum shield staring at him -eyes bulging. Air still cut off.

dialogues.speaker: DESK SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Goddammit stop!!! You stop right fucking there!!! The Creature raises his human shield over his head. Befor the men can fire at his exposed chest --hurls the Officer them. But this is no ordinary throw -the man is rocketing down corridor as if propelled out of a catapult. Men are diving out of his way. One taken out completely. Tumbling down the corridor with him and smashing into a g trophy case.

dialogues.speaker: TROPHIES GOING EVERYWHERE.
dialogues.text: INT. POHO SHERIFF’S DEPARTMENT BACK HALL. NIGHT. SAME TIM Trish, Darry and Jezelle hurrying through the darkness. C hear the chaos in the distance. Come upon a large rear do with a safety bar and an alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darry tries it. Won’t open. Tries it again viciously. Whi to Jezelle.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: This is your way out?!

dialogues.speaker: JEZELLE
dialogues.text: The doors must lock automatically in a power out.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: You didn’t know that?!

dialogues.speaker: JEZELLE
dialogues.text: Well I'm sorry honey but I can't dream everything now can

dialogues.speaker: I
dialogues.text: Eyes and ears on alert: the distant commotion is suddenly still. Deathly still.

dialogues.speaker: JEZELLE
dialogues.text: We have to get upstairs!

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: We have to get out!

dialogues.speaker: JEZELLE
dialogues.text: There’s no other way out down here except the front.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: How are we gonna get out from upstairs!? Darry sees it first: At the far end of the hall. A famili silhouette. Still. Impassive.

dialogues.speaker: JEZELLE
dialogues.text: Upstairs. Trish and Darry dash up the stairs and The Creature takes toward them like a rocket. Sprints so fast his coat billows in his wake, like dark w Jezelle just kneels. No chance she could make it up those stairs fast enough. Instead, bows her head in prayer as t Creature races toward her.

dialogues.speaker: JEZELLE
dialogues.text: Our Father who art in Heaven, hallowed be Thy name...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Creature is so close she can feel his wind... can fee blasting past her. Her moment of doom has passed quickly. She turns and sees Creature racing up the stairs at top speed. INT. SHERIFF’S DEPARTMENT SECOND STORY. NIGHT. SAME TIME. Trish and Darry running for their lives. Where to they do know. The corridors are dark and maze-like. Stopping finally. Confused whether to keep moving or find place and hide. They don’t have to think long. The Creature roars into vi ahead of them and they start a nightmare flight back into maze. The Creature pursues with incredible speed. The kids practically falling around corners they are running so fa Behind them like some Dark Avenger, the Creature soars. Gaining. Always gaining. Rounds another corner and halts: The kids gone. Several d they could've slipped into. He chooses one. The Creature in the doorway. This is an interrogation roo Dark and empty. Caught by its own reflection in the large mirror on the wall. A two-way mirror. On the other side, Trish and Darry, watching breathless. Terrified as the Creature surveys th mirror and steps toward it. The kids silent. Holding each other. The terrible visage the Thing pressed against the glass now. Does it sense something behind it? Those white eyes staring in. As if they could see through And then its tongue comes out. Long. Licks the glass from to high in some horrible, pre-culinary gesture. Trish and Darry watching with repulsion. Then relief. Hav left a snail trail on the mirror, the Creature is turning away. Turning away from the mirror and- KER-TASSSSHHH! !!! The plexi-window explodes as the Creat crashes through it. Trish and Darry scrambling back in a blind panic and a shower of glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Creature in the center of the room. Poised like an animal, ready to pounce. Trish and Darry can barely move. Paralyzed with fear as t Thing steps closer. Backs them to the wall. Brother and sister, side by side. Those hideous milky eyes glare at Trish. Burning into her Watches as he inches closer. Darry starts to move. Pinned against the wall instantly b the Creature's iron grip. Pinned there watching as the Creature moves even closer to his sister.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: (barely a whisper) Darry... Nose to nose now they are so close. She can feel the horr stench of his cannibal breath. Its horrible, raspy whispe now:

dialogues.speaker: THE CREATURE
dialogues.text: Sister, sister... Watches in terror as it gets so close she thinks it might kiss her... But it sniffs her instead. Short little sniffs at first. Darry and Trish watching th in horror. Then sniffs long and deep as Trish stares full of fear, i those horrible eyes. Eyes that close as another deep inhale commences. They op again -abruptly. Stares at her a moment longer and tosses aside. The Creature instantly on Darry. Nose to nose. A big deep inhale as little brother watches. Tries to find his siste somewhere on the floor. His whisper like a child's.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Please let me smell bad... Please let me smell bad, Trish... Another long inhale. This time, the Creature’s head drops back. Darry can see the nostrils. Flaring. Fluttering. Nostrils don’t flutter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They do it again. As if the scent they were sampling, sen his nostrils into uncontrollable twitching.... There can be no doubt, as the Creature levels those eyes Darry -that it has found what it wants. Something about o inside him it finds irresistible...

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Its gonna eat me Trish.... This motherfucker’s gonna eat me.... CLINK CLANK! RIFLES BEING COCKED. BIG ONES. The Creature halts but doesn’t turn. The shattered window the other room is filled with FOUR OFFICERS IN RIOT GEAR. Sergeant their leader.

dialogues.speaker: DESK SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Step away from the kid. The Creature still doesn’t move. Stares at Darry.

dialogues.speaker: DESK SERGEANT
dialogues.text: (cont‘d) Darius? Just step this way with your sister. Darry stares at the Creature for a long moment. Then slow inches down the wall. The Creature watching him. Once out from under him, Darry scrambles to Trish and the fly out the door into the hall. The Creature turns toward them, but all rifles raise. The Creature slowly raises his head -eyes glaring at them from an angry furrowed brow that seems to say Who in the fuck do you think you are? The Creature roars toward them and the guns blaze. INT. POHO SHERIFF’S DEPARTMENT STAIRWELL. NIGHT. SAME TIM AS THE SOUNDS OF A WAR RAGE OVERHEAD, Trish and Darry scramble down a stairwell that empties into the dark lobb Halted by the bodies scattered everywhere. Like a massacr ONE BODY sticking half out a plexi-glass window he was th through. A BODY at the corner of the Sergeant’s desk is just a tor His bottom half no where to be seen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trish and Darry blast forward. Sprinting through the atrocities and toward the entrance. The glass doors -also shattered by AN OFFICER'S BODY hanging half in and out. They step over him and out to the parking lot. EXT. POHO COUNTY SHERIFF'S BLDG. EXT. NIGHT. SAME TIME. Trish and Darry searching frantically for their car. They Jezelle’s Winnebago. But not a sign of their own vehicle. way to drive out of here. Except for the Creature’s black van still idling in the corner of the lot. MORE GUNSHOT BLASTS and flashes from the second story. To Darry, the choice is simple. He is sprinting toward th van.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: No! Little brother sprints to the driver door and throws it o A STENCH SO FOUL meets him that he has to grimace. Thinks twice about this now.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: I am not doing this Darry!

dialogues.speaker: STORY WINDOW.
dialogues.text: DARRY (cont'd) Trisha! !!!! Before their bodies can even hit the ground, Darry braves stench. Leaps up into the driver’s seat. Reaches instinctively for the ignition. No key. The van is runnin without a key in the ignition. Clutches the gear shift. Sticky. Looks at his palm. Stick congealed, crimson goo. Its like a thin film over everything. The passenger door flies open. Trish reaching out for brother’s hand. Halting with the stench. Staring at him. He just gives her arm a good yank and she is up and flyin into the seat. The van rattling with her weight. And soun like a windchime?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look behind them and see why: the van walls are line with an incredible and grizzly array of spears, axes and knives. All hanging from mounted hooks -THE WEAPONS CLANKING AND TINKLING TOGETHER WITH THE MOVEMENT OF THE VAN. Blades all stained by an eternity of atrocities. The Creature appears now. On the roof of the building. Da staring in horror at him from the van window. Even at thi distance, caught in his terrifying, demon-blind glare.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: What the Hell are you waiting for?! Darry grapples the sticky gear shift again -tries to get in first. THE GEARS GRIND -SHRIEKING AS IF THEY WERE SOUL BEING TORTURED. The Creature vaults forward. Leaping impossibly off the r of the building and onto the roof of Jezelle’s Winnebago. Landing on his feet. Glaring at Darry. Starting across th parking lot. Not on the ground. He has leapt into the air and is leapi from police car roof to police car roof with each stride.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Hang on! Damned gears. They grind away. Trish staring back -the Creature leaping from car to car some nightmare gymnast. Its tattered coat flapping like d distressed wings. Darry finally forces the gearshift forward. Doesn’t know he’s in first or not. Guns it. It lurches roughly and stops. Must be in second. The Creature hits one final car top and vaults into space directly at them.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Darry!!! The van lurches forward again. Moving now but not fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KE--RONKKK!!! The Creature smacks into the side of the va His face rearing up into Darry’s window. Staring in. Darr terrified. Still trying to get up speed.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Give me something!! Trish out of her seat. The van lurching again. Throws her into the back. Tries to keep her balance. SPEARS AND BATT AXES CLANGING ALL AROUND HER. The Creature rakes his claw-like fingers across the glass a circular motion. Slicing into it with A HORRIBLE SHRIEK

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Get me something! !!! The Creature rears his hand back -ready to strike the cir he has scored in the glass...

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Trish- Something smacks into the palm of Darry's hand. He doesn’ even take time to see what it is. Just swings it at the window hard. KER-TASSHHH!!!! He hits the Creature directly in the face with a small combination hatchet/hammer. Glass flying out everywhere as the Creature drops off the van. Crashing to earth as Darry speeds away.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Yesss!ii!ii!! Trish watching. Wants to smile too. Shout with joy like h brother.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: (shouting into the rearview) Motherfucker! !!!! But instead Trish stares out the back windows of the van. Watching the dazed Creature raising his head. Staring aft them as they get further and further away. Darry guns the engine. The van is really moving now. Roar away from the Sheriff's building and down the empty two l

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Darry... A warning from sis. Brother checks out the rearview: the distant Creature is on his feet now. And running. Running toward them.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: (his smile more manic now) He’s kidding right? In his rearview: the Creature sprinting after them. Sprin like Hell.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: He’s not getting smaller... He is actually gaining on them. His legs a blur of darkne he is coming so fast. Darry checking the speedometer: the van is doing 120 mile hour. And the Creature is gaining on him.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: You mother..... Darry’s foot flattening the gas pedal. To the floorboards The old van shakes and quakes at this velocity. THE SPEAR AND AXES CLANKING NOISILY. Then another impossible nightmare: the sprinting Creature without slowing down- throws himself forward like an acro doing a running tumble-- But when he completes his flip -landing on his feet again uses the momentum to push off. And in an affront to gravi everywhere: rockets himself up into the night sky. Up and gone. Out of view. Brother and sister both saw it. Look to each other.

dialogues.speaker: WHOMP
dialogues.text: THE VAN’S TRAJECTORY. IT WEAVES ACROSS THE ROAD. DARRY TR TO WIN BACK CONTROL. KA-RANKK!!!! The Creature's battle axe punches a hole in top of the van, right in front of Darry’s face.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Trish!!! She scrambles for one of the spears. Grabs a shorter one. Thrusts it straight up. Over her brother's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THWAAMMPPPP!!! Pierces the roof and puncture’s the creature’s head. Directly above the eyes! The Creature loses his grip on the van, slides back and o falling onto the road again. Darry watching in the rearview.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Yes!!! Hits the asphalt hard. The spear dislodges as it rolls ov and over down the two lane.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Yessss!!! Rolls and rolls and suddenly leaps up, lands on his feet keeps on coming! Darry’s enthusiasm gone. Just watches breathless as this inhuman thing comes at them again! The Creature has never moved faster. So fast powder is co off his skin, a skin being eaten away by the actual wind shear at this velocity.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah! Burn your ass up you son- of-a-bitch! He is like a comet now -a rocket of dust blasting down th highway toward the van.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Watch it... Trish scrambling for another weapon. THE CREATURE’S VELOCITY IS MAKING ITS OWN HISSING SOUND.. Brother and sister listening to it grow LOUDER AND LOUDER Trish with an angry looking battle axe at the ready. Sees SCREAMING dust storm is almost upon them. KA-POOOMMM!!!! The back doors blast inward as the Creatur explodes into the van. Trish thrown ahead against the dash. Darry losing control again. The van hits the shoulder of the road hard! Inside the Creature advances. Trish lurching forward with axe at the ready for him. She swings it:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THWOCK!!! HIS HEAD IS NEATLY SLICED OFF. Leaves a small p of dust at his neck as it rolls right out the back of the and down the highway. The Creature’s headless body staggering back. Trish stari at it. Charges ahead with the same weapon and hurls it! Direct hit! Knocks the torso back out the doors. It hits the asphalt hard and goes rolling and rolling in sporadic puffs of dust...

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Yes!!! The van roars ahead. In the distance. A TRAIN WHISTLE. Da listening to it. Looks at his sister.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Where is he?! Trish takes no time to stare out the windows again.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: He’s dead! He doesn’t have a head!!!

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: He’s not!

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Darry! He doesn’t have a fucking head!!

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: He’s not!

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: How’s he supposed to eat any thing without a head?!!! Brother and sister staring breathless at each other. Darr words are calm now. Almost whispered.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: He’s not gonna stop. (emphatically) He is never gonna stop, Trish!!! The Railway crossing ahead. The CLANKING SOUND of the WAR BELLS and the Automatic arms.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Get out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can’t believe he said this.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: I mean it, get out! (off her incredulous look) There’s grass over there!

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: He’s dead!

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: He’s not! We both know he’s not! THE TRAIN HORN BLASTS NOW. A warning it is almost to the crossing.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Do it!!

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: What the Hell’re you gonna do?! KA-RANNKKK!!!! Down comes the Creature’s hand again, maki larger hole in the roof of the van, grappling for Darry’s head. It finds him. Holds on tight. Darry screaming. Trish race forward.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Look out!!! She swings the axe again! THWOMP!!! The hand grappling he brother is severed. It falls to the ground and she kicks out the back of the van. It hits hard in a cloud of dust... Up top: the armless, headless Creature reaches down again with his one remaining arm...

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Goddammit Trish, I’m not doing this for nothing-

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: You're not doing anything without me! She takes another long sharp spear and thrusts it through roof of the van. Up top: the spear-head pierces the Creature’s headless to pinning it to the top of the van. This makes him more angry. His remaining arm reaching dow for Darry -grapples with new violence for his head. Finds Darry trying to wrench it off him. It starts to pull him upward. Trish runs forward with her axe but little brother surpri her. Grabs her arm and pulls her onto his lap.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Darry! Forces the axe out of her hand. Kicks open his door. Look terrified as he flashes a last look at her.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: Bye sis- Throws his sister out of the van. She screams as she hits soft grass and rolls and rolls. The train is upon them. WARNING BELLS DEAFENING. LIGHTS FLASHING. And Darry clutching the arm of the Creature as tight as h can. The creature lifting him -up out of his seat. Darry fighting it. Bracing himself with his hands against roof of the van.

dialogues.speaker: DARRY
dialogues.text: You got me?! You got me you son-of- a-bitch?! Huh?!

dialogues.speaker: THE AUTOMATIC ARMS.
dialogues.text: Trish in the grass, stunned. Looking out. The van on a collision course with the oncoming train.

dialogues.speaker: REACHES THE TRACKS AT THE SAME MOMENT.
dialogues.text: The headless Creature struggling. Darry clutching it’s ar helping it to remain impaled to the roof of the van, as--

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTIONS.
dialogues.text: Trish is already crying. Sobbing as the blast lights her bruised and bleeding face. It is raining debris now. Fiery debris and bits and piece cloth and metal. But nothing human. Nothing inhuman for that matter. Trish stares ahead from the grass. Sobs. Inconsolable in the ta grass.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. TRAIN CROSSING. MORNING. TWO HOURS LATER.
dialogues.text: Trish in a police car. In the back seat. Wrapped in a blanket. Still in shock. Workers sifting through the ash debris of what lay across the tracks. Jezelle knocks on the window. Trish rolls it down.

dialogues.speaker: JEZELLE
dialogues.text: Your parents are waiting for you back at the Sheriff's Building. I heard it on the scanner. Trish doesn’t look at her. Just stares out. Jezelle draws breath and starts to step away.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Your dreams are wrong. Jezelle stops. Turns and looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Sometimes. Darry didn't die like you said he would.

dialogues.speaker: JEZELLE
dialogues.text: Sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jezelle nods in silent agreement. Though there is somethi in her eyes we cannot discern. She turns away. Moves toward her Winnebago. Trisha lookin on. Somewhere we hear the tune Jeeper’s Creeper’s. Instrument version. Playful. Strange in this grim context as we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somewhere off that same country two lane, in the long sha of the dying sun, this old packing plant sits. It is rust and sagging and as we approach, and our music continues, begin moving down. Down toward the ground beneath the old structure.... INT. OLD PACKING PLANT. BASEMENT LEVEL. NIGHT. In dank darkness, the music continues. Sounds like it's playing on a phonograph somewhere. Yes a phonograph. The kind with lots of analog hiss. We move toward the music, along an empty wall. At the end of which, in the long shadows, a tall figure i cape-like coat busies himself. Though we can’t tell with until we are up close. Sewing. Stitching. Fingers working nimbly with coarse bla thread. We see now the wall is not entirely empty. Several bodies mounted there. Not the ancient dead we have seen undergro at the church. These are fresher. Of much more recent demise. Sewn toget in the same grizzly fashion we know too well. And then KER-PLUNK! A new body is hung next to them. Hung a hook which we cannot see. Young Darry. Eye lids sewn shut with large, nasty looking stitches. The latest addition in this new mural of human horrors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The instrumental bridge of the song ends and the lyrics e in this vast underground chamber. ...-Jeepers Creepers, where’d you get those Peepers? Jeep Creepers, where’d you get those eyes? Echoing as we begin to back away from this sad and grizzl sight... the Creature beginning to sew Darry onto the oth As this begins WE SLOWLY FADE TO BLACK as our song contin ...-Jeepers Creepers, where’d you get those Peepers? Jeep Jeepers, Weepers Creepers, where did you get those eyes?
